Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: F3011
Reviews.Content: Very good staff and location, pool on the roof and buffet restaurant that I have not seen the better of. I thought breakfast was good but evening buffet was superb. Sushi, fresh sea food, BBQ , and a massive range of desserts including moved ice cream ang chocolate fountain. We were well looked after despite being the only Anglos and all food was explained to us. Thanks Kenneth, maitre di extraordinaire. I will be coming back to HK if only for the food. Wi Fi no issue on 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Agatha G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2012. Location is excellent, easily accessible from the airport using Bus 21. Was not expecting much since I am used to staying in Business Hotels, and this was more of a fun side trip before my business trip to Shenzhen. Was pleasantly surprised by the room layout ! I really liked the setup of having 2 floors in my room, what an excellent use of space ( though I didn't like having to walk down the steps to use the bathroom in the middle of the night !). Enjoyed being right on Nathan road, the street is bustling till midnight daily, lots of options for food and shopping. The only bad thing was the rotten fruit they serve in the rooms, and I mean rotten apples, which clearly are recycled from guest to guest. Other than that, I would definitely stay here again for a personal trip (not a business hotel for sure !)

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel for trip in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: JITHM
Reviews.Content: Staying there for 2 nights with sister for exploring Hong Kong. Jordan Subway Station just right down under the hotel and connected with the shopping mall. Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui are just one station from here or walking also a good choice for shilling on Nathan Road. Room was clean and Comfortable for two, but smoking smelt was very strong through we requested non-smoking floor. Staffs are nice and helpful since our first step to drop all stuffs before taking turbojet to Macau. Recommend this hotel to many friend and they came out with a good feedback

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no wifi”
Reviews.Author: dybl_0644
Reviews.Content: Not idea for family with young kids as the shower head is mounted on wall. Other hotel once you request for 1 additional bath towel on 1st night, they will provide the same till you check out however in this hotel, you need to request for it every night. Great location as it is just above MTR however you need to go through rounds of escalators before you can reach Hotel lobby. No free wifi in hotel. Will prefer to book a hotel with free wifi in future.

Reviews.Title: “Right above the underground, great rates but...”
Reviews.Author: nong t
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you want to be smack in the middle of Kowloon and right on top of the Jordan MTR. In a great location with LOTS of food and shopping - all open until 11pm! The hotel does not provide much in terms of service or hospitality but this is China and this being a mass market, medium price point, no frills hotel... it didn't really matter. Wifi at the hotel is expensive, so if you have a 3G enabled cell phone, just cross the street and next to the entrance of the MTR you can buy a internet net SIM card for unlimited internet for something like 3 USD per day.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Hui18
Reviews.Content: Booked 3d2n & the location was good & very near to jordan mtr. Staffs are friendly. Room are generally clean. The minus point was that there is no free wifi in room. Charges are 25hkd for 1hr, 50hkd for 3hrs & 120hkd for full day. At times you can hear people talking outside the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tellithowitisreview
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel recently on business trip for 2 nights. Its location is great, especially for the MTR - the rooms are clean large and do not suffer from road noise. Breakfast buffet was extensive and of good quality. Unfortunately the roof top swimming pool was closed due to stormy weather during my stay, however I would return and try it out on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “great location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ilovehk9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Prudential hotel for 4 nights. Considering it is a 4* hotel, I expected it to be big enough as the information stated was 24sqm room size. Upon arrival, I was disappointed the room looked more like 19sqm. A bit cramp for 3 people but it's ok. Maybe the layout of the table made the room look small. After the first few days it wasn't really as bad as I thought. The hotel is located above Exit E of Jordan mtr. Just across the street to Exit D there is a Wellcome supermarket. From the main entrance of the hotel, turn right and walk down nathan road u will get to Yau Ma Tei and Mongkok. Turn left u will get to Tsim Sha Tsui. The famous northpoint egg waffles can be found along the way from Jordan to Tsim Sha Tsui. Location of the hotel is great. Parkes Street has a lot of nice food. Australian Dairy and Tsui Wah are at Exit A. The downside of this hotel is that there is no free wifi. The previous 3* hotel I stayed in offered free wifi. Maybe if they offered free wifi i will stay here again. Bought the internet SIM card at HKD$180 to last throughout the trip. The staff is very friendly he tried to help me set up the 3G on my phone when I asked for help. However he could not get the 3G working and gave me the direction to get to the mobile shop. Service is good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...but Bed BUGS!!”
Reviews.Author: ci_pen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 3-7 June'12. Great location, can easily find restaurants, convenience shops and laundry shops. There are laundry shops in Parkles street and Woo Sung street, just next to Temple Street. Can buy cheap mineral water from the Yee Wah department store at HKD 5 for 1.5 litre, compared to HKD10 sold at other places for same brand. Can hear water flushing at night. But it's ok when we get used to it and we were too tired. Later my husband and I found out we were biten by the bed bugs at our legs. We still feel itchy after 4 days returned from the hotel. We were stying in room 1221. We read about the bed bugs in this hotel before, and we thought the possibilities are low, but we were wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Fully equipped. Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: iambodin
Reviews.Content: Location : excellent ! Hotel building is built over Exit E of "Jordan station" MTR which leads to underground Prudential department store. You need to ascend escalators for 2 or 3 floors to reach the ground floor where The bag deposit & concierge counter is located and for 1 and a half floor to reach the lobby & reception counter. No elevator from MTR floor to lobby. That's why after department store closed at 9 PM (may be 10 PM) you have to use Exit D which leads to nearby building (don't worry, it's very near to hotel's front door). Receptionist : Very good Polite, capable of English communication, helpful. Interior atmosphere : Very good Modern, quiet, nice views from panoramic elevators. Room : Good Fully equipped for fundamental features. Clean bed & bedsheet, nice table, chic couch (I like this couch personally), standard bathroom (tub, shower head with hot & cool water controller, flush toilet, Hair dryer). Nothing special but adequate for normal traveler's usual requirement. Internet : no free internet, ADSL and wifi is overrated. I prefer using my aircard + CSL internet sim. Bottom line : This is gonna be my first choice hotel for my next trip to HK. That's it !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: luvbabe11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 2 nights at the Prudential Hotel from 4-6 Jun. Generally, it is a clean hotel. I originally requested for a double bed room and eventually shifted to a room with a king size bed which was good enough to accomodate 2 adults and 2 kids (age 2 and 5). This hotel is located right above the Jordan MTR station which is easily accessible to many places. The only thing is that there are still staircases around which linked to the Prudential Centre shopping mall. The lift on the ground floor where the Concierge was also unavailable for the guests to use. Instead I had to lug the stroller and the kids up the escalator.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Rates for HK”
Reviews.Author: Lifeadventurers
Reviews.Content: The Prudential provided us with a very clean, well maintained room. The staff were all helpful and quite friendly. Being directly above the Jordan MTR was ideal for getting arond the city, and so easy to get back to. The actual hotel reception area is not all that obvious to locate as it is on the fourth floor above numerous shops. The only complaint was trying to get our luggage up the very narrow escalators whilst the only lift from the ground floor to the reception area is for staff only.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: AdventureLive
Reviews.Content: The location is good, the staff were efficient and helpful. Overall good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideally located in Kowloon, very close to downtown HK”
Reviews.Author: n1cknick
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, ideally situation on the main road of Kowloon. Surrounded by very good shopping malls selling everything from designer clothes and shoes to electronics - all within easy walking distance. The hotel actually sits on top of a six floor shopping mall, which sells clothes and other various commodities. Also situated by main MTR station which is about 2 mins walk away. I stayed here on business for one night, before I headed over the border to Shenzhen. Staff were very friendly and efficient. Room were super clean and modern, and in my opinion, spot on for the price. Food and drink was good in hotel's restaurant. My only gripe was that they advertised free wi-fi, however it isnt free. Its actually quite expensive so if you need it, you could pay around $6US per hour and its not the fastest. Would recommend this for business travellers / couples / and sight-seers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: SNA G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 13 Apr - 16 Apr! It was fantastic! Initially, we didnt expect too much from this hotel due to the poor reviews we've read! But to our surprise, it's different from what we've read! We booked a deluxe room: -nice and clean room, very spacious, the king bed and the pillow was superb (coz i usually will dislike hotel's pillow when travelling)! I dont find the room smells eventhough we took the "Smoking room" - toilet is clean - no stain - towels are clean too -safebox which is easy to use -no theft or anything missing eventhough we forgot to put the "do no disturb" sign - and they still clean our room -very friendly staff -concierge was helpful Excellent location! Just above Jordan MTR! Just a 5minute walk to Temple Street Market! One stop away from TST MTR! Simply love it! Its very convinient! There's buses, MTR, Cab. I dont find the escalator troublesome at all! hee! maybe i find it "different" from other country. Will love to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very safe.”
Reviews.Author: ushirl
Reviews.Content: Dear Travelers; I just returned from a trip to Hong Kong and had a pleasure to stay at this hotel. Rooms were fairly small but average for a hotel located in a such a large city. The hotel is located right above the metro which is very convenient. Also, within walking distance to several shops and malls. There is also a mall connected to the hotel which is an added bonus to shoppaholics... Overall a good experience. Clean, safe, and reasonable price. Downfall: Concierge doesnt speak English very well. I was left doing my own exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorenzo01_10
Reviews.Content: Good location on Nathan Road in Kowloon, but this is an old hotel that has had lip stick applied to make it new and shiny in the lobby. Rooms are outdated - like an old Holiday Inn - with very basic amenities. Horrible shower head, nasty formica, thin towels, etc. Had items in my room stolen - not of much value (not worthy of the safe) - that really makes you wonder about your safety and whether the rest of your property is going to go missing as well. Concierge was useless. Asking for a restaurant recommendation, he adivsed the Spaghetti restaurant across the street. Seriously. Avoid this hotel. Good neighborhood to be in, but not this property. Breakfast was basic and routinely included the stale bread from the day before.

Reviews.Title: “o.k”
Reviews.Author: bitton
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, worth the value paid for it. Clean rooms at a good level. Breakfast is varied and fresh. I was disappointed from the service, part of the service to be exact, bellman was very impatient and not nice. Also sous chef at breakfast was impatient, not nice. Hotel location excellent, the city's central location with direct access to the subway!

Reviews.Title: “OMG this was bad”
Reviews.Author: Greatnortherners
Reviews.Content: The ONLY good thing about this place was being close to Jordan MTR station. The bed was terrible,with a foam top that moved and then the sheets came away from bed within 2 hours of sleeping. I next woke to hear people walking down the hallway and could hear everything they said.Then the man in next room when to the toilet. Trust me I could tell it was a man. Never ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location... Average Hotel...Below average staff...”
Reviews.Author: episcan
Reviews.Content: Way Costlier than several Hung Hom area hotels (On the Victoria Bay) because of NATHAN Road (U shop till u drop). Not visible ( NO SIGN NO NEON) from the main street. If you are taking a cab, tell the intersection to the driver ( Nathan & Jordan). Very small beds. Breakfast (138 HK$) is a rip-off. Go outside and eat. Front desk is slow (very slow). Internet price is another rip-off. Buy a Wi-Fi card from next door 7 Eleven for 20 HK$ (24 hrs). Otherwise as you only sleep in your room while in HongKong...its okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very close to MTR”
Reviews.Author: mee4
Reviews.Content: When arriving from HKG airport, you can take bus A21 to get to Prudential. Follow the signs to get to the Airbus or Bus after baggage claim. You can use your Octobus card, pay at the cashier or if you have exact change, pay on the bus. The cost is $33hk per person. It took an hour and 15 mins to the hotel and they drop you off right in front. Highly recommend the bus upon arrival. When leaving, you can take bus A21 back to the airport. The bell desk can let you know where the stop is. The walk is about 2 mins to the stop and I believe it comes every hour. Hotel was clean. I stayed there last March 2011 during the renovation and it was quite an improvement. The lobby looks much nicer. The double beds in the room were quite small - 2 twins. The location is perfect as the MTR is located right below the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Relakjack
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right above the Jordan MTR, which makes for great ease of travel. It is also right across the street from the Temple Street night market, which is nice for a touristy stroll, although we much prefer the Fa Yuen Street market, which is only 2 stops away at Mongkok. The rooms were decent sized, and staff were friendly and helpful. Bathroom was a bit tired, but honestly in Hong Kong, hotel rooms are only for sleeping, there is always so much to do. There is a great yum cha place in the same building, on the third floor, but you do need to come out of the mall, and take the next entrance. All in, a good place to stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Other than location, the rest....hmmm”
Reviews.Author: AhPek
Reviews.Content: First time in the hotel..most likely the last. Other than the good location, the rest not worth mentioning. Had to carry the luggage a few steps up to reach the concierge. Then take another 2 flights on the escalator to reach the hotel reception. Front desk staff was not friendly. Room do not have complimentary mineral water (I'm quite surprise they did not provide). There was one night around 12.30am in the morning and someone was vacuuming outside. I can even hear toilet flushing and people talking loudly in the other room in the middle of the night. I had been to HK at least 7 times the last few years and each time in a different hotel and this, would not be my choice anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. Excellent location -- MTR exits just a few steps away.”
Reviews.Author: Jade820
Reviews.Content: Very convenient. The hotel is right above MTR exit E and Prudential Center (a mall). Exit D is just a few steps away, right around the corner. You can enter the hotel through the mall's entrance at Nathan road, through MTR exit E below the mall, or through the hotel main entrance along Tak Shing street, which is adjacent to Nathan road. Take the main entrance if you need help with your luggage. We were upgraded to a deluxe room. It was spacious with wide floor-to-ceiling window overlooking Nathan road. The marbled bathroom was lovely with angled mirrors (perfect for ladies). Closet had folding doors covered with full-length mirrors. Loved the soft, bouncy pillows! It was a bit challenging speaking with some of the staff on duty, but it's not a deal breaker. We'd gladly stay here again. (+) Spacious room Wide floor-to-ceiling window Lovely bathroom Ingenious use of space (smart desk design with countertop/bar, "hidden" mini ref cabinet, and electrical outlets) Very accessible (MTR exits -- one below and another one just around the corner; money changer, small food shops, and 711 just a few steps from the main entrance) Good service Roof deck with swimming pool (pool closed during winter) (-) No free internet/wifi No breakfast included Some of the staff can't communicate well in English

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business trip especially if you need to be in Kowloon area.”
Reviews.Author: jmeens
Reviews.Content: Simple, clean hotel centrally located in Kowloon. Food is good, staff is friendly and helpfull. Not a hotel were you can stay all day and entertain yourself, but who wants to anyway when Hong Kong is waiting outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneLeapy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week on the recommendation of our travel agent. It is very well located with easy access to the MTR. We found that few of the staff spoke English to any degree and the three times I asked the Concierge for information was largely a waste of time due to their poor English. We had a voicemail about cleaning our room as we forgot to take off the "Do Not Disturb" sign on our way out one morning, but it took two days to get through to someone to take the red light reminder off the phone. I had trouble with the safe and had two staff there to sort it out within minutes which was a big tick, but when I asked housekeeping about a softer pillow I just ended up with another exactly the same as the hard one I already had. The hotel is quite dated but clean, and the breakfast buffet adequate without being amazing. Staff tended to wait until everything was empty to top up things, or until you specifically asked for something. There is nowhere to sit in the lobby and the foyer area is largely a long couch that wasn't inviting to linger. I couldn't find a great deal of information about what services the hotel had to offer as there was no information in our room and the TV info didn't tell us a lot more either. I didn't see any indication of a tour desk, or pamphlets about where to go (we took those from the Holiday Inn up the road). I wasn't aware that the hotel changed money until we were checking out (their rates were not good anyway) As long as you are an independent type of traveller this hotel is a good place to stay, and we were not pestered by all the touts that hang around more "Western" hotels like the Holiday Inn which is a little further down Nathan Road. I thought this hotel was quite good value for Hong Kong, but only for tourists willing to do their own research about Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great buffet breakfast - family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Elaine D
Reviews.Content: We stayed only two nights at this hotel but found it to be clean, tidy and family friendly. Travelling alone with my two children on stopover to London, they allowed me to check in early around 11.00 am after getting in to HK at 6.00 am I was very grateful. Hotel concierge checked tours we had already booked, transfers and we also loved the central location. Big thumbs up. Would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good and staff are helpful”
Reviews.Author: katrinachong
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just above Jordan station which makes travelling around very convenient. Walking distance to temple street. There are many shops and restaurants too. The staff are helpful when we approached them for street direction. The room is clean and the size is acceptable with one roll away bed plus sofa and a writing table. There is enough space for luggages too. Remember to request for non-smoking floor. Overall is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Helps if you speak some Cantonese?”
Reviews.Author: Fareastender
Reviews.Content: This was not a booking I made myself, but had to use someone to find me 'any' hotel during a busy trade show period. The room was ordinary, I asked for a non-smoking room, which was not available, as the check in clerk to her colleague in Cantonese. I told her back what she said and then the trusty came out. Even so, the room was a bit smelly, but as it was past midnight and I was out of there at 8am, I just got on with it. The rooms are very old and the bathroom small and poor. I had to run around in the shower to get wet! The 'gym' was obviously a guest room with a treadmill and a weight machine in it, both of which a were we'll past there sell by dates. Breakfast was more geared to Asian than western tastes. Only stay there iF you have no alternative .

Reviews.Title: “It like going back home!”
Reviews.Author: lew_hw
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th times back to the hotel. As usual gotten upper level n comfortable room. This time only spend 4days. But service is still good.. Everyday receive newspaper at our door. And also check in that time was given complimentary fruits. The lobby was finally renovated finished. Went in July they are still working on it.. The lobby is nicer n brighter.

Reviews.Title: “It would have been perfect if...”
Reviews.Author: KengSoon_C
Reviews.Content: You read what others said... everything's been well and fine, but no wifi in a HK hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Katar11na
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in this hotel with my family. Location was convenient, there is subway and shopping mall in the same building, many restaurants, 7-eleven and International food shop nearby. China ferry terminal is a short trip away, taxi is available next to the hotel. Room was a bit small but I suppose that is common in Hong Kong. Our 4-years old slept on the sofa and we were able to fit a baby cot in the room for younger child. Room was clean and in good condition. Breakfast was basic but ok. Overall this hotel was quite average, no big surprises and nothing to complain about. I could stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location.”
Reviews.Author: jopet
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Prudential for 5 nights. The location is just perfect. Very handy right on top of the MTR so travel anywhere was so easy. The room was very clean and the bed and pillows were like sleeping on a cloud. Very comfortable. Check in staff were friendly and helpful with any questions. This was our second stay at this hotel and we would definitely stay here again next time we're in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location n great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lew_hw
Reviews.Content: It's my 4th times back to tis hotel. This time went with my friend and family to stay at this hotel. Always find it very comfortable to stay in and becoz of it's location of the hotel. Even if it raining, you can reach the hotel without getting drench. Their service very prompt and good. Room wise very comfortable. The nearby restaurants are nice too. Like the one beside the hotel, it has the xiao long bao very nice. I going back to the hotel this November again! :) Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: roangi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011. The location is great, being right ontop of an MTR station. It is also in quite a good spot in TST with many restaurants surrounding it, a few steps away from Kowloon Park, about a 10 minute walk from HK China Ferry termanial (if you are planning on going to Macau). Hotel staff were friendly. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay but they could have done better”
Reviews.Author: Keng Soon C
Reviews.Content: Check-in (and out) were basically hassle free, the receptionist was helpful to arrange for an early check-in. Try using other MTR exits other than 'E' to explore the nearby places (like packing some desserts on your way back to the hotel) else you are just heading straight up to the room after exiting from MTR station. The hotel should really offer free WiFi service for its guests (it's not a cheap hotel after all). Overall okay as it's not located at the most crowded place in HK but still relatively easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, impersonal but fine”
Reviews.Author: PetraVisser
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Prudential for four nights at the end of august. Reception staff and concierge were helpful. Check in was quick and easy, bags were sent to our room, no hassle there. The new reception area looks really nice, so does the recently renovated restaurant (we did not eat there, too expensive for our taste) Swimming pool is nice, although they could have done a bit more to make the rooftop terrace more appealing (bar, more plants etc.) The room we stayed in was fine, although we had some problems flushing the toilet. Bathtub really small, but shower really nice! The one thing that kind of bothered me was that there was no free Wi Fi, we''ve stayed a loads of hotels en guesthouses during our travels in China and all of them offered free Wi Fi. I thought the Prudential charged a rather large fee for a rather slow internet connection. I think free Wi Fi should be part of servie in this day and age :-) The hotel is in my opinion very impersonal, but I think that is inherent to big hotels. You kind of feel lost in the long grey (indeed noisy) corridors. But all in all it was a nice place to stay I think. Worth the money....considering the location I would have to say yes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, but will probably look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: dreamchan
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 10 days. I requested for high floor & was given a room on the 9th floor. I asked for a long stay discount, but they did not give it to us. From my research, quite a no. of hotels in HK would have given a discount for stay >7-days. I chose this hotel for its location as I have a toddler. Location is fantastic, right above Jordan MTR. If you do not want to go through the flights of escalators through Exit E (Prudential Center), you can choose the exit for FourSeas Building. (beware of e stairs !) You will appear right at the ground level & the hotel is a few steps across the road. Considering Jordan is not as crowded at TST or Mongkok, it doesn't gives you the rushed/being pushed feeling when you commute daily. Lots of eateries nearby. I didn't enjoy my stay this time round as the hotel was too crowded. Sound proofing was next to none. Everynight I could hear people talking loudly in the corridor or banging their doors. I even know if my neighbour was taking a bath. To reduce the noise, I had to seep towels underneath the main door & the connecting room door. For my next trip, I will try other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Double thumbs up for great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gr00vyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Upon booking: Ask for room facing Nathan Road as facing Tak Shing Street isn't pretty, high floor to lessen traffic noise. Packing needs: ~ Cotton T's/shorts/hats/sunnies/sunblock a must to face Aug heat & humidity in HKG. ~ Leave the umbrella at home & borrow one from the concierge ie. more luggage space for shopping! ~ Ear plugs for light sleepers as walls are paper-thin - can hear every shower & toilet flush from nearby rooms. Guests don't seem to observe noise etiquette with tv volumes & talking esp. late hours. Spoken from personal experience... Access via: ~ Nathan Rd - face the building & take the right-most short staircase (about 10 steps) - don't go down the large staircase/escalator as that's towards MTR Jordan. Take the 1st right turn (notice the overhanging Prudential Hotel LED sign) just before a tailor shop. Go past glass door (interconnects shopping centre & hotel) & take escalator up to lobby. If luggage is too heavy to lug up stairs, walk/roll a few metres to the right & take a left into Tak Shing Street - hotel entrance is just to the left. Walk up the short staircase & ask the bellboy for assistance. Repeat in reverse when checking out. ~ MTR Jordan - take Exit E & go up 3 escalators. Look for tailor shop & hotel LED sign, go through the glass door. Oh yes, glass door is open betw 10am & some late hour - check with hotel in case arriving real early/late. Hotel renovation works was supposedly done in July but was still ongoing during our stay in early Aug. Altho our room came with 1 complimentary daily b'fast, 1 visit was enough to say it all. Fortunately, there are plenty of eats nearby at Parkes St, Shanghai St, etc - tastier & cheaper too. Those who need their caffeine fix can pop into the familiar green-starred franchise abt 2 mins walk down Nathan Rd, it's on a side street to the left. Didn't get a chance to check out the rooftop swimming pool - closed due to thunderstorm alert. Sigh...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and good stay”
Reviews.Author: dreamyparadise
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Prudential for all of our shopping trips to Hong Kong -- it's conveniently located above the Jordan MTR, close to great eateries (e.g. Australia Dairy Company, Mak Noodles). We have never gone to the hotel cafe or restaurant simply coz of the great food options around. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The staff were polite and while the lobby renovations were going on, there were minimal inconveniences. Strongly recommended :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, will certainly stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: OldFellah
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Prudential Hotel for 12 nights during July 2011 and have to rate this hotel as excellent. We were a bit sceptical because of some negative reviews on TripAdvisor but found everything to be simply great. Firstly, the location of this hotel cannot be overstated, it is right on top of the Jordan MTR, down a few flights of escalators, if you are carrying bags of loot from your many shopping trips around HK, there is nothing better than being only 1-2 minutes from your room after you get off the MTR, amazing. Yes the escalators do stop at 11pm, so either time your arrival night just before then, or just deal with it ! If you arrive on a very late flight, use the concierge entrance just around the south corner of the building and they will handle the bags for you. But a few tips are needed about check in, if you arrive on the #21 bus from the airport (only 33 HK$) and get off in front of the hotel, dont walk down the big central set of steps to access the escalator, just take the small set of steps going up to the right, they lead straight to the Concierge desk on the right , and dont criticise the hotel for the security guards' lack of English, they work for the shopping complex, not the Prudential Hotel. Staff were as friendly and helpful as they could be, always quick with a smile, knew everything we needed to know, quick to help with bags etc, as good as any hotel we have stayed in. And their English was very good. We had requested several things by email and were always answered in minutes, so on arrival we had a room high up and facing Nathan Rd. We tried as much as possible on this trip to be totally devoid of phones, Facebook and email, so were not concerned about internet access, on the last day we used the business centre for a few minutes to confirm flight details and contact family, all for a small charge. In spite of the lobby renovations going on we were not the slightest bit bothered, check in-check out time was only a few minutes, and their are a ton of cheap eats all around the hotel, also found a cheap laundry just behind the hotel which we used every few days. Only a few minutes walk to Temple St night market, still a great place to visit, browse, haggle, or just people watch, and 2 MTR stops to Ladies market, much larger but much much more crowded. Well done Prudential staff, you gave us a great visit and we will certainly stay with you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel with a fab location”
Reviews.Author: PallaviUday
Reviews.Content: Prudential is wonderful for so many reasons. The Hotel's location works in its favour. The underground metro Jordan is located within the hotel complex. The hotel by itself is very comfortable and visitors have options to do so much within the hotel thanks to the mall located below. Location wise nothing beats Prudential. There are lovely stores located all around, so many places to eat at and so many stores to visit. The famous Night market is located five minutes away and one can walk to and fro. I have lovely memories of Prudential.

Reviews.Title: “check that the renovations are finished before booking”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy2170
Reviews.Content: before booking check that the renovations have finished. Was not happy after a 19 hour flight, wanted to relax and just enjoy the hotel but was not told about the hotel being renovated. However the room was nice and clean. The location is great walking distant to the night market at Temple Street and to the harbour. Best market was the Ladies market so much more to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Visit”
Reviews.Author: HKGRegular
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Prudential half a dozen times over the last few years. The position suited us for business - directly above Jordon MTR and small shopping complex. On our last visit (May 2011) we found the hotel being renovated. (Not noted on any hotel booking websites). On check in we found we had been put in a very small room. When queried we were advised that on each previous visit we had been given an upgrade. And for some reason they could not upgrade us on this trip. Basic double room was very small and very ordinary. Buffet breakfast was held in a ridiculous area tucked in near the elevators on an upper floor. I imagine things will improve after the renovation but they are bound to put their prices up. Ah well will have to find a new favourite HKG hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kris-LondonGB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, via Expedia. Knew before hand of building work in reception, but I think cheap rate reflected this. Room on 15th floor. Comfortable bed, sofa, desk, nice bathroom (best shower ever) and very clean. Free WIFI in room. Did not use pool on the roof, but nice view from there. Very busy area around hotel, but always felt safe. Easy to get to, via airport express to Kowloon and then free connector bus (K1 - I think) to Jordan subway station. Hotel just around the corner. Overall good, reasonable priced, 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Anandspeaks
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel in Nov'10. The hotel is at very convenient location with very good connectivity to all locations. The room sizes were smaller than expected. But overall, we found it to be good if you dont intend to spend much time at hotel. Good for business travel. No leisure facilities as such.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: PGMAustralia
Reviews.Content: Good location, MTR station is in the basement of the same building. Several buses stop right outside the front of the hotel heading down Nathan Road to Star Ferry, bus number 1, 6 and 9 from memory. Rooms clean and tidy and recently renovated but don't think there was too much renovation done in the bathrooms. Access to hotel is a bit odd, it is actually part of a shopping centre so you have to go up a couple of escalators from the Nathan Road entry to get to the reception area. Taxis will drop you off at the rear of the hotel where you are met by the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location and spacious room for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: syb_loves_holidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Prudential for 5 nights in March 2011. After reading about the reviews on sizes of hotel rooms in Hong Kong, we were a little sceptical about what we were going to get. The rooms in Prudential were spacious and very clean. Even though it is right on Nathan Road, we couldn't hear the traffic noise. The air-conditioning unit was indeed rather loud but you do get used to it after a while. When we were there, the lobby and reception were being refurbished so it was a little messy and the signage to the reception wasn't too obvious. The main entrance to the hotel is actually around the back and not on Nathan Road itself so if you were getting to the hotel via public transport, you will have to keep your eyes peeled for some signs of the hotel. We nearly walked straight past it while dragging 2 big suitcases along Nathan Road. The location of the hotel is very convenient for MTR station (Jordan MTR station is within the same building of the hotel) and there is an airport express bus direct to the front of the hotel. It is a 10mins walk to the main part of Tsim Sha Tsui. The housekeeping staff was very efficient and came into the room to wipe down the bathroom and replace the tea and coffee sachets daily. However, they could do with being a little quieter while talking to each other on the corridors. Wifi in this hotel is not free and you have to pay for it. I would probably advise to go to a starbucks or public place where there is free wifi available. We didn't pay for the Wifi in the hotel, so I don't know what the speed is like. This hotel is definitely recommended, albeit a little pricey. However, all hotels in Hong Kong are quite expensive as are most hotels in cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location thats all”
Reviews.Author: billyboy9501
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel only because we were unable to make reservations at our preferred hotel as it was fully booked. The hotel itself is in a great location. On top of the Jordon MTR station which gave great access to all of HK. The hotel is undergoing refurbishments in the reception and restaurant areas, which caused some disruptions. Although the room was clean and comfortable it was small and even though we booked a Grand Deluxe room the amenities were basic and no tea bags at all were supplied only coffee and sugar. The Hot water tap would always make a very loud noise when turned on. (We could also hear that from the adjoining rooms) The mattress was the hardest I have ever sleep on Reception Staff were helpful but the same can not be said for the Concierge Staff who upon our check out rudely demanded we return to our room and bring down a (Very old) set of bathroom scales we had borrowed to check our luggage weights. We had requested these at 10.30am and they arrived at our room at 2.15pm just in time for our departure. When I asked the Bellman if he could help with our luggage he couldn’t or didn’t want to understand my request, so I took our own luggage down. Would we stay here again….. No!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: bvonm
Reviews.Content: Location: The location is quite central for the Kowloon area, there is train access close by as well as buses and it is attached to a shopping mall (hint: there is better shopping at cheaper if you just walk around the area). The Temple Street market is a 5 to 10 minute walk away, with plenty of local places to eat everywhere you walk, and there is another small market right across the street. If you don't feel adventurous to try the local cuisine (which is exquisite, btw), head across the street to the Spaghetti House for some simple pasta dishes (don't bother with the higher end seafood dishes here, they're not worth it, stick with the basics), and a 24-hour MacDonalds is a 5 minute walk away. Rooms: The room I was in was spacious with a chaise and little work desk. I think I was upgraded, I also had a glass portal that jutted out from the building, which gave me a nice view up and down Nathan Road. I got a decent price booking through Agoda, about USD$175 per night: I could have saved a few bucks going to a lower end hotel, but I wanted clean and safe, so went with this one for a few dollars more. I was on a non-smoking floor (11th) and the room appeared to have been newly renovated, it was spotlessly clean with a comfortable queen (or king?) bed (I thought it felt firm, but slept like a baby on it). Plenty of room, nice strong shower, good toiletries. The front desk will provide a power adaptor at no charge. Lobby: Lobby was ok as a temporary fix due to renovations at the time of my stay, reception is on the second floor with escalators taking you up, there are a few bellboys at hand to bring your luggage up for you (they also deliver straight to the room after you check in so you don't have to lug them up the escalators, no charge unless you want to tip). As mentioned, there were renovations going on during my stay, but unless you're planning on hanging out in the makeshift lobby for prolonged periods of time, there should be minimal impact on your stay. There is a small temporary business center (1 computer, three chairs) tucked away in the corner of the lobby. Amenities: Basic gym on the upper floor, I think there was a pool too although I did . There is also a rooftop observatory for a view of the surroundings. There is also an on-site restaurant with an extensive menu. You pay for internet in the room, USD$3 for 30 minutes, with marginally better rates as you buy more time (although beware, once you log out, your time keeps rolling so you have to use it all at once). Staff: Staff were always friendly and helpful. Getting there: You can take a train, taxi or shuttle. I wasn't in the mood to get lost in Hong Kong or to experiment with the subway / train system, so I got the shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel for about USD$13 each way (second passenger USD$10), well worth the 60 to 90 minute ride in my opinion for door-to-door service. You'll probably pay somewhere around USD$50 or USD$60 for a regular cab ride door-to-door. Random tip: I didn't have very long in HK, so I took an organized tour (not usually the preferred option) with Gray Line tours; there is lots to see and plenty of driving between sights, but the deluxe tour with lunch on the biggest floating restaurant in the world was nice, and took the better part of the day, although it can get you back in time to see the city lights laser show at 8pm with time to spare. They pick you up and drop off at your hotel. Base price is something like USD$71, but expect to pay about USD$90 or USD$100, which covers the extra activities (short boat ride, photo taken of you at the tram station overlooking HK, tip, etc). English speaking guide incuded: by going with the tour, we avoided an hour lineup at least for the tram alone: again, this tour was not the cheapest option, but was the easiest from what I saw and the simplicity / all-inclusiveness was worth the cost for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean and convinient at best price”
Reviews.Author: ASIF R
Reviews.Content: I with my wife and two kids 10 and 14 stayed there for four nights in summer. We booked one double + one twin interconnecting rooms. The rooms were well decorated and very clean. The beds were also very comfortable and crisply clean. Hotels location is excellent with shopping centre and Metro station in the basements of this hotel. Temple street market, MckDonalds, Other restaurents, Money changer all are near this hotel. Its the best, location wise and comfort wise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, large clean room, decent service”
Reviews.Author: Katchy03
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the infamous Temple Street nightmarket and a few short stops away from the best shopping districts via MTR. Large room, very clean bathroom. No real complaints except that the air conditioning unit was too noisy to leave on at night - not so much of a problem in winter. Unfortunately no free wifi and wifi price was excessive - used a net cafe instead. Nice enough staff gave good directions when asked (in English).

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: Unless you need to stay in this part of Kowloon (Jordan), I cannot think of one reason to stay at this hotel. The list of things that are wrong is so long I couldn't possibly list them all. From the sad, small rooms in which very little worked properly (and the fixtures and furnishings were shoddy or falling apart) to the uniformly unhappy and unhelpful staff, this place is to be avoided. Specific grievances included air-conditioning that never worked as it should; towels that were little more than thin rags; so many carpet stains that going barefoot in the room was not an option; consistently boring food; and outrageous internet access charges (as high as HK$200 per day). The highlight was checking out early so I could get to a hotel where I felt welcomed and could relax in comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Hong Kong Visit”
Reviews.Author: nonbg123
Reviews.Content: I am staying here right now and it is a great hotel in a fantastic convient location. Check in was very good and efficient with good English skills. Room is spacious and faces the street so view is good (even numbered rooms on the 13th floor face the street). Room is clean, in very good condition and all amenities are good. Internet came with the room and is fast and stable ( great for work), good work desk provided in room. all room amenities are in excellent condition and all toiletries and consumerables are supplied in the bathroom. Location is number 1 being on top of Jordan station and everything in Kowloon is in walking distance, really just a stroll to everything. Bus from airport (A21) drops you at the front door and the return bus stop is right across the street. This a great hotel and will be my new base in Hong Kong when I am here from now on

Reviews.Title: “staff need training on being courteous!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travelNZ
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to Asia extremely frequently we were looking forward to staying in Hong Kong and had heard good feedback in terms of the Prudential. When we arrived at the hotel on Nathan Road - we entered the door where two or three porters were on duty. When we asked them a question - they were extremely offhand and one partcularly rude not speaking but just hand jesturing to upstairs. As I say we travel annually to asian countries and we were both quite suprised by such off handedness. We then proceeded to check in and the queues were very busy with one line feeding the check in staff. This line was managed by a man - who again was most officious. We arrived at the check in counter and a young lady (I think Jen or Jin) started to process us.... and I will say process - she could not look up to greet us, everything was just routine and totally inpersonal. My first impression of this hotel is not good and we were not made welcome at all. I found it odd too that it appeared that the swimming pool was closed every day over the lunch break "for cleaning" for me personally - a time I would most likely use the pool. I can only commend the room attendants who always said good morning and were courteous. The hotel is dated, the rooms naturally small (it is Hong Kong)- and in terms of cleanliness - OK. The location is handy near the Jordan MTR - but personally I will stay elsewhere next time just because of the agressively unhelpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: lancome_10
Reviews.Content: wow! we are properly accommodated by the staff, they are very helpful and patience in our questions, like where to go, how to go there. and the most.. i can understand their english . the room was very comfortable, included the bed, and the cleanliness of every corner... easy access to subway, and thank you to Mr, STANLY TSANG, the very friendly chief concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: shrynz
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a bit dated and worn. Fortunately the rooms where clean, and no sign of bed bugs as in other reviews. The internet is cheap enough ($200 hk for 3 days) but is prone to dropping out. Some of the staff dont seem too knowledgable about their own services (ie getting a second login for internet) but if you ask enough times they will check with other staff members. With the MTR close by eveything it within easy reach, shopping, disneyland etc My only complaints :- - If you make use of the av ports you cannot change the volume on the tv, which if your media player doest have volume options makes it not useable and the hotel does not want to change it for us (the volume buttons have been disabled) - Thin walls, if other guests are noisey you're going to know about it, luckily the staff are quick to respond to complaints and will sort this for you :) Basiclly if your looking for cheap and dont watch much tv this will probaly do for you

Reviews.Title: “lack of facility”
Reviews.Author: vio86
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated on above the jordan mtr station but thers no lift from the station to the hotel lobby either from the basement of the shopping center, only have staircase or escalator, no convenient for family with young children who need travel with stroller all the time. the hotel room is spacious. the hospitality service is quite nice. the wifi of the hotel is only for laptop user, cannot support either iphone or PDA.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Shannahs_SG
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just above the MTR station (Jordan) and conveniently located around shopping areas (Tsim Sha Tsui & Mongkok). Bus A21 (to airport) is available at bus-stop in front of hotel, free Airport express bus-stop to Kowloon MTR station is also around the corner. Huge hotel room with lots of space (little difficulties with walking even with 2 huge luggage). Nonetheless, bathroom facilities are a bit old, need refurbishment. Bathroom towels and bedsheets are clean but looks worn out. Room's Internet access is fast and reasonably charged.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: lvanniek
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this: If you are looking for an affordable hotel with a great location in Kowloon look no further. If you are not familiar with the Hotel's location the entrance might be difficult to find. Take the airport express to kowloon station and a taxi from there. The check in is efficient and friendly. The rooms big for Hong Kong standards which is nice when you have a big suitcase and traveling with a partner. The decorations are very plain. But the rooms are clean and the beds are very comfortable. The best feature of this hotel is it's location. It is just across the street from Jordan MTR station. One stop away from from shopping in Tsim Sha Tsui. The Prudential is 10 min walk from the market and in my opinion the best place to have dinner. There are a choice of 2 great restaurants on the street, where you can enjoy great food and some beers, cheaply. I will definitely stay here again when I go to Hong Kong again. Please don't make the same mistake as me and stay in the Kowloon Hotel in Tsim sha Tsui. Oh and I forgot to mention they have a great swimming pool on the roof. It's closed during winter time though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: LanPing
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally convenient location, spacious CLEAN rooms, excellent and well-priced lunch buffet; staff slightly prickly and roftop pool closed due to thunderstorm, but all in all and excellent experience I have always been nervous about second-tier hotels in HK; this experience may well have cured me

Reviews.Title: “Second stay and No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: DanilleT
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time I have stayed at the Prudential Hotel and once again, I can not complain about anything with this hotel. Great location, great service, great buffet breakfast, great bar (although can be expensive outside of happy hour). Stayed here with a 6 month old and the staff were all too kind to allow me to use the staff elevator to get to and from the hotel room. They helped each time with the pram to get up and down stairs - can not compliment the staff enough. Definately stay here....

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: J2820
Reviews.Content: I check in late and check out early, so I have no much comments on other hotel facilities Comment base on the room I stay. Likes - Good location, just above Jordan MTR. - Stone throw away from tourist attraction area ( Temple street, shopping centers, food & etc) - Room is clean. - Given preference room as requested. - Stay at high level, quiet Dislikes - toilet facilities need to improve. - water pressure is low. - lobby at 3rd level. - working desk is placed too near to the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!!”
Reviews.Author: metcalve
Reviews.Content: As mentioned by another reviewer, bedbugs is a major issue in this hotel. I left the hotel after 4 nights with bedbugs all over my two feet. Came to Hong Kong after having spent 2 nights in Grand Hyatt Macau, so was definitely disappointed with the standard of the hotel, which seems old, tired and uncomfortable. Check-in staff was cold and eager to get the job done, mentioned the rates to me twice, and I had to nudge him before he told me about the internet (which came with the package). I chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the MTR Jordan station (at the basement of the hotel) and it's locality along Nathan Road, which is my preferred area when I come to Hong Kong. The MTR is really useful, and the night market (Temple Street) across the road with its eateries are convenient for every traveller on holiday. Ladies Street (another night market, a much bigger one) is two MTR stations away at Mongkok. Stations available on the TV are highly limited. Unless you don't want to walk the 100m to the MTR station, stay somewhere else and don't bother with this hotel until they refurbish the rooms or burn away all their mattresses. I will be going back to the Nathan Rooms (refurbished ones) at Nathan Hotel the next time I go back to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: prettymum
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last week, 1st night still ok, 2nd night wake up, my hands & legs full of love bites from the bed bugs, I notified the reception and they change a room to a higher floor for me, but still having the same problem. When my last night stayed, only discovered that there is sign or card placed in the TOILET, saying due to environmental care, if you likes to have the deb sheet changed, to place that card on the bed. Faint ~~~ this card should have placed at somewhere at the room where ppl easy to see, no wonder I got those bedbugs bitten. Its not only 1 , its at least 50 red marks on my arms and legs and my friends too. In the end, when I checked out, I complained about this and got a free shuttle bus trip to airport but which I think is NOT WORTH with all those bugs marks on my arms and legs now.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: flair76
Reviews.Content: I specifically requested our travel agent to book us again at the Prudential hotel since we stayed at the Prudential Hotel 2 years ago and was very much satisfied with the quality of their rooms. It was really spacious- had two beds. Bathroom amenities were complete and the room was very clean. This time, I was surprised when I stepped inside the room that it was much smaller than the room offered to us before. The room offered to us 2 years ago was a much bigger room - probably the superior as it was really spacious. Their standard room was small - internet information indicate it was 40 sq. m but I'm sure the information wasn't updated. The standard room was probably around 25 sq. m. The room was still clean, but the cabinet was really small. The couch had a large stain and the bathtub and toilet bowl were clean but there were stains that couldn't be removed. Bathroom amenities were also "downsized". There was also this "cabinet" on the wall behind the bedside table which had a lock (probably a switch of some sort inside since the elevator was located just outside our room) and there was this gap between the top of the door and the wall which was unsightly. The TV had only 2 english channels, I think and no disney or children's channel. Overall, the room is clean and comfortable, but it wasn't what I expected as the first time I stayed there I was really impressed. This time, you could see there are some wear and tear and maybe they would need a bit of repairs here and there. Last time we also had bathrobes and and iron - but this time there were none. There was also smoke smell inside the room when we returned to the hotel - and ours was a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor. THe hotel staff said it was probably due to the airconditioning - some guests somewhere might have been smoking inside the room and brought the smoke smell to our room. The next day housekeeping did spray some airfreshener to clear up the bad smell. Nothing beats the location of this hotel though. It's absolutely great! The MTR is just below the hotel and there is a mall as well. Staff were efficient and housekeeping were very helpful. There was this concierge though when we were checking out who refused to help us with our bags - We had to carry them to our bus as the travel agent was waiting to take us to the airport. In fairness to him, there were lots of baggages there so maybe he was a bit overwhelmed. Still, he could've said it nicely and not put on a bad face. The other concierge were nice though and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to people who are in HOngkong for shopping - it's got lots of shops and outlets and lots of restos too. It's very very accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: docmia
Reviews.Content: Prudential Hotel is an excellent choice for travellers going to Kowloon, HK. The Cityflyer bus (from the airport) stops right in front of the hotel and the bus stop going to the airport is just a few meters down the opposite side of the street. The Jordan MTR is right under the hotel and going to the Hongkong side is just 2 stops away from this MTR. The rooms are spacious enough with a king-size bed, ref, sofa, roomy bathroom 9with tub). The staff are very courteous and helpful. Plus, there's a swimming pool on the roof and stores on the first 6 floors. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately updated, moderate service, good transport connections”
Reviews.Author: anonymousor
Reviews.Content: room has maybe been updated since I stayed. The room were modern even in 07 through the tv was old and had few channels. It looks like tv are upgraded now. When I was there the bathroom did not seem upgraded much... big and clean but older style. Shower has no spray just fire hose like jet. Ok for money but I didn't like the in hotel restaurant. Also the pool and bullet elevator were closed when I was there or maybe I would have liked it more. Pool i guess is closed every off season.

Reviews.Title: “a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cotton-clouds
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time in this hotel, and it was disappointing, or maybe I was especting more. The location is great just above the jordan station, there's a supermarket just around the corner, and a great restaurant 'Sate King' on the basement of the mall connecting to the hotel. Room is big in Hong Kong standard, clean and great view. My only complaint is I booked thru the internet requesting a room near the elevator, and after arriving late at night the receptionist give me a card, I did not give it any thoughts until I was on end of the corridor, they had given me the 1st room which is located on the opposite end of the elevator. I called and complained, and the girl told me there's no room available, I told her I would just personally go down to talk with the manager, but after hanging up the phone for a few seconds she called again and rudely told me to go down immediately to change card for a much nearer room. I did not say anything more because I was just too tired.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel lobby is on the 3rd floor, need to carry luggage up.”
Reviews.Author: enezst
Reviews.Content: Interior hotel is well maintained and clean. The Jordan MTR station is just located below the hotel. They have many restaurants and HK cafes on the other side of the road. Walkable distance to temple street. Only disadvantages are: you need to have the Chinese name of your hotel to show to taxi driver and also the lobby is located on the 3rd floor. You need to carry your luggages down to first level via the escalator. I will still stay in this hotel for my next trip

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: panda_22005
Reviews.Content: Very cosy and nice hotel room. Staff will clean and replenish the room everyday without fail. Toilet very clean and bright. Location just above jordan station. Highly recommended to travellers with family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice room”
Reviews.Author: SouthSko
Reviews.Content: Right in a shopping mall. If you come in through the street you will have to go down a story or you can enter on the side. It doesn't have the best view, but I spent all my time outside the room. The rooms were kind of neat and stylish. You can get lost in the downtown and turn over new leafs and most people speak English and can tell you how to get back to Nathan Road. I paid $150+ 10%. A tad bit expensive, but not bad. I would return The only US type plug is in the bathroom, so you may need to get down to the local shops and get an adapter. It was only a few $.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel—just know what you'll be paying for”
Reviews.Author: dragfyre
Reviews.Content: The Prudential's location is its best asset—nestled in among the hectic cityscape of Kowloon's Nathan Rd., it's within walking distance of enough major sights, shopping destinations, restaurants and parks to keep you going throughout your whole stay. I walked or took the local double-decker buses for most of my trip and had no problems getting where I wanted; the hotel's concierge was very helpful in making my stay in Kowloon a good one. I had some trouble finding the entrance from Nathan Rd.; the more obvious entrance is on a side street, and the entrance facing Nathan Rd. is hidden away inside an open-air shopping mall., marked with an LED sign. Getting into the hotel and past the front desk may very well be your only hassle; the entrance is crowded and cramped and, at least when I was there, the (seemingly understaffed!) front desk staff seemed hopelessly swamped by incoming tour groups, although the pressure was showing. I was a little suspicious of their request to put a room deposit on my credit card upon my arrival, and remembered thinking, "What, extra charges already?" I received the deposit back, but was charged for other items I didn't expect to pay for, e.g. Internet use (apparently, there is no free internet service anywhere in Hong Kong, except the airport). After asking for double-checks and receipts for all these transactions, I felt satisfied that they were at least fully informing me of all the extra charges. The room was beautiful (barring the view of skyscrapers), and the facilities, though some were under renovation, were very good; the rooftop pool is definitely worth a try. As for food, I spent most of my time eating elsewhere, since the in-house restaurant and bar seemed overly expensive and didn't really appeal to me (especially since I felt I had given enough in extra charges already), and the hotel's location warrants the outside experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LibraGalSingapore
Reviews.Content: We've been to Hong Kong a couple of times previously and have always stayed at this hotel. One of the reason is because the MTR station is just below the hotel. How much more convenient can it get?? There's also plenty of eating place around, from small shops to fast food to restaurants. All are within walking distance. Also, plenty of shops around so, shopping is also fantastic :) Apart from the great location, the rooms are also spacious. Only thing is there is not much of a view from the rooms. But, it was clean and everything was in good working order and more importanly, the beds were comfortable. I would stay at this hotel again should I return to Hong Kong and would recommend it anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: HKL0ver
Reviews.Content: Our family have visited Hongkong several times & we have stayed in this hotel twice. Was not too happy the first time as we were put in a supposedly non-smoking room with loads of cigarettes smell in both the rooms. However, this time round was alot better. The location is superb as the MTR is just at the basement of the hotel. Besides, there are many eateries within walking distance from the hotel vicinity. We will patronise it again if we were to visit Hongkong again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lit2kim
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the majority of my trip around Christmas time. I thought the location was great! MTR at the bottom of the hotel, on Nathan Rd., close to Temple Streetwith lots of eateries and shops close by. I would consider the room western sized. I stayed at the Kowloon hotel for 3 days and while it was nice, only really had room for the bed. Our room at the Prudential had a king sized bed and enough space for a chaise. The lobby area can get a little busy and is small. If checking out, I would recommend that you try to go early if you can. Around Christmas and New Year's they close down Nathan Rd and people hang out in the street. I thought it was convenient that our hotel was right in front of that so we could join in the festivities.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: tnku
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well situated with close links to the train and a shopping mall. Only 2 stops to hong kong island. The hotel rooms were clean and spacious. However, the staff were not as friendly as expected for a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “spotlessly clean hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: SLCKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: We definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. It's conveniently located with several MTR exits/entrances very near the hotel including one just below the hotel. Although I must say we rather use the MTR exits/entrances located just one minute walk from the hotel than go via the 4 levels of escalators to reach the MTR exit/entrance just below the hotel. Having said that, when it rains or when the weather outside turns cold, it was indeed convenient to use the MTR exit/entrance just below the hotel. We loved the location of the hotel. Wellcome supermarket is just 30 seconds walk from the hotel where you can buy cheap fresh fruits, groceries etc. Guardian (mannings) just opposite the hotel and plenty of shops surrounding the hotel. There are lots of good eateries at BOWRING STREET across the road from the hotel. We love the Hong Kong set menu breakfast which comes in a combination of congee and fried noodles and tea/coffee OR bacon, toast, noodle soup and coffee/tea etc. Almost all eateries serve this. Very extensive combinations and all for a very reasonable price of around HKD 18 to 25. We travelled with a 2 year old child in a stroller and found the steps and escalators abit of a hassle. The hotel staff were kind enough to allow us to use the lifts which were actually meant for hotel staff only. So that was absolutely great. The hotel room was large by Hong Kong standards so that's a definite plus point. Plus the fact that the room was spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: susyarcy
Reviews.Content: It's okay. Expensive (as every decent hotel in Hong Kong). It's clean, the rooms were small, the location is convenient (it's inside a mall haha), and the staff is okay (HK people are not that nice anyways..).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay and have a great trip”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandSandyNZ
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with great service, good sized rooms not little boxes. Duplex rooms have balconies looking over Nathan Rd which is beautiful at night. Friendly helpful staff and the breakfast is great. Great rates by booking at the hotel site over the net and we only booked two weeks prior to arrival. We've stayed there twice now and the quality of service and room has been fantastic each time. Close to markets, directly above an MTR (Train) station which makes travel around Hong Kong and also to Shenzheng in China easy and cheap. Tour office on reception floor of hotel if wanted where the staff are helpful. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable and simply what is needed on a business trip”
Reviews.Author: YoniYuval
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Prudential hotel during end of Oct. 2009. the hotel is located above a big shopping center with connection to the MTR Jordan station. just perfect location. rooms were clean, comfortable and welcoming. internat access, both wire and wireless, very easy to connect and use. prices are very reasonable. was actually upgraded when they were full.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugs_Two
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Prudential. Right from the moment we arrived the staff couldn't have been more attentive. The entire hotel was spotless and we found it totally faultless. Breakast was included in our tariff and was a great start to the day. We didn't have evening dinner in the hotel but ate twice at the restaurant in the basement just before entering the Jordon MTR. We had a Duplex Suite and appreciated complimentary bottled water replenished daily. A real treat was the bottle of wine and fruit platter that was a gift from the hotel. The bed was ultra comfortable, bathroom light and bright and generously stocked with lovely products. Lots of lamps and good lighting. Two tellies. We had a view of other buildings but then Hong Kong comes alive with fabulous lights at night so the view was more than agreeable for us, especially the first night when the weather gave us a fork lightning show. Free unlimited broadband was welcome and efficient. It is centrally located on Nathan Road, and right above the Jordon MTR station. It's easy to get to from the airport. Just get the A21 bus right outside and literally get off at the door. We'd recommend buying an Octopus card at the airport. You can use it on trains, buses, ferries, MTR underground tubes and the Ding Ding tram, plus a few select shops. The markets are fun and we enjoyed the jade market. Highlights (of various sorts) of our holiday were Ocean Park where you can see Pandas. The old walled Kowloon City, and not forgetting being treated to a bit of Typhoon Koppa! The Museums are rich in history and very interesting. One thing that won't interest everyone but it's a nice trip out in the New Territtory to the Kaldoorie Farm and Botanical Gardens. Expansive gardens of huge altitude but an incredibly peaceful place. If you're fit and active, something to consider. We enjoyed our holiday in Hong Kong and this definitely won't be our last one there. Never once did we feel unsafe or ill at ease and we found the locals to be humble lovely people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cam_and_Dodo
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at the Prudential and were quite happy with it. The location, in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Nathan Road is great and the hotel is directly connected via a shopping centre to Jordan MTR station, no need to get out! The rooms are decently sized and with tasteful and modern decor. Wide king size bed (it could be longer) flat screen TV. Minus points for the slightly crammed lobby and for the useless concierge service which is nothing more than a luggage storage right at the entrance. We paid around 65 euros per night booking on expedia with no breakfast (not a problem as there are several cafes and restaurants all around the shop). Internet is quite expensive unless you upgrade to the "Deluxe room" where it's included. Bear in mind though that the internet is the only difference between "deluxe" and "superior" room (we stayed three night in the first one and three in the second one). The only other difference are two bananas and a kiwi in a platter, the rooms are absolutely identical. What else? You get a free newspaper hanging from the door handle in the morning, the place is quiet, the laundry is expensive but there is a cheap one just one road behind it. For the money is difficult to imagine a place better suited for visitors.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, not great”
Reviews.Author: Globetrottin_Grannie
Reviews.Content: Prudential Hotel HK I chose this for our return trip to HK after 8 weeks in UK/Europe based on reviews here. We had stayed on Lantau Island going over and had 5 nights here returning to Sydney. We took the A21 bus as advised, only HK$cheap and stops right outside-walk straight ahead and take the 1st turn left [we had to ask someone] the hotel concierge desk is up about 6-7 steps. A porter took our luggage, gave us a receipt and directed us up to the Reception-a VERY small area. Check in was fairly straightforward-I’d prepaid .Luggage delivered to our Deluxe non smoking room very promptly. The room was fine-looked exactly like the hotel picture. Fairly spacious, A/C worked-it was very hot while we were there,fridge,coffee making. A fruit platter delivered on the 1st evening. It was right next to the lift-which was noisy after a while, avoid the lift. WIFI was included, not breakfast-there were so many eateries around that we never ate in the hotel at all, so I can’t comment on that. The pool was closed the 1st 2 days because of a typhoon warning-DH had a few dips after that-he said was fine. What had sold me the most on this place was the location-over the Jordan MTR. That actually was not a great bonus because, there were so many escalators [6 I think ] to reach Reception-all going through the Mall, it was really slow,and tiresome. And worst of all-the escalators from Jordan were closed from 10.00pm until 10.00 am. Then, the station had to be reached by going out the concierge exit onto the street and walking to the next entrance. Tourists are likely to go out early, and return late,so location location-evaporated. We used the bus more than the MTR in the end. Octopus card in hand at all times. It was very handy to the Temple St market-we had dinner there 3 nights. Unfortunately, the end of our trip was spoiled because I was ill [not food poisoning] we were not flying out until midnight the last day, and were not able to complete our plans. My husband asked for a late check out-and they very kindly gave us until 4.00pm, the best they could do, as the hotel was full-at no charge. Which we appreciated very much. However, the staff standard of English was generally poor; we had several mangled conversations at the desk and with the concierge. There are so many hotels, if I go to Hong Kong again, I will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved all about the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJ7SABAH
Reviews.Content: me and my wife loved this hotel very much; FRIENDLY STAFF, VERY FAST LIFT, MODERN EQUIPPED ROOM & STRATEGICALLY LOCATED (below is JORDAN MTR). Definitely will check in this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: tartarSingapore
Reviews.Content: We had a duplex suiote which was v lovely being 2 storeys . the bed and pillows were very comfortable and room facilities were adequate. The conciege service was v good, they spoke good english and was v fast and efficient. I managed to get help for storing my breast milk in the freezer everyday and even kept my luggage with them when i went to shenzhen. They are also v helpful and polite, Location was pretty good except you need to climb escalators to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Find at a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Prudential Hotel, particularly since I felt lucky to have received a room that had the all-glass bay window, so I could step into the bay window, and have sense of being suspended over Nathan Road, a very commercial street. While the room was rather small, the space was utilized with the greatest efficiency. The room was very clean, and it had even slippers available. For its price, the hotel definitely delivers more than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: itchyleg
Reviews.Content: Was upgraded to the Penthouse level when we arrived late at night and rooms are fully occupied. Super view of kowloon at night , clean and big rooms ... location is very convient except for the small front lobby .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CarTraveller13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location. Jordan station is just a few floors down from the hotel. Nathan Road & buses on the doorstep & very easy walking distance to Temple Street Night markets. Rooms were clean & comfortable with plenty of room for a standard hotel room. As sightseeing & shopping were our focus this hotel was ideal. Air con which is a must was good & English channels on the TV enough to keep us happy. A very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: ZhuhaiKid
Reviews.Content: I was here for a weekend right after the Chinese New Year. This is a great location. Right on Nathan Road and all of the wonderful shopping. The room was a good size and clean. The bar/lounge was very nice. The staff was very pleasant and very helpful. Did I mention the location? The Jordan MTR is right there. If you stay in Kowloon, this is the place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel right on nathan road, kowloon”
Reviews.Author: WolvesFordy
Reviews.Content: Get the train at the airport and it drops you off under the hotel.Rooms are ok with aircon and a good bathroom.Ask for free internet when you check in.Bars and restaurants in the hotel are a bit pricey though,so ..
