McDonalds 100m away and a 7 11 shop 25m away for a beer in your room if you want.Chinese breakfast available at a shop behind the hotel 15 HKD,and pastries and coffee available over the road.A reasonable curry can be found on Nathan Road 150m away with a couple of beers 150HKD.Go to harbour at 7.30 to get a good spot for light show,and be there for 7.00 if your going to the peak to watch.Go early,9.00ish for nong ping and disney.

Reviews.Title: “really perfect location and great room”
Reviews.Author: tavish101
Reviews.Content: booked online and was not expecting too much, but was really pleasantly surprised. really central position on nathan road- though not in most touristy section of it, which suited us perfectly. its in same building as the MTR, so makes getting about really easy. simple to find the hotel- easy from A21 bus from airport which was cheaper than airport express and nice service. hotel staff didnt really say much- but if you arent there to make friends with them (!) then you will be fine- they are courteous but dont get too involved unless u make an effort to greet them etc- this was fine by us!! room was a twin though we thought we had asked for a double, but hotel was full, so couldnt change it. large room- comfy beds, and very clean. perfect base for exploring an awesome city! we didnt eat at hotel as there were cheaper more interesting places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels - worth the value”
Reviews.Author: reichan
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that for those who are looking for a hotel which is near an mtr, reasonable rates, great service, fantastic location, surrounded by food stalls, 7-elevens and shopping streets, look no further. Initially was told by an agency to get Largos hotel, which is also near the Jorden MTR, but after checking the maps, i changed my mind. I have no idea why people over at largos gave the hotel a thumbs up for location, but trust me, after a long day of shopping in hong kong, the last thing you want would be to walk all the way back to your hotel from the jorden MTR. In short, prudential hotel is simply ABOVE the MTR. Yes. Once you are back at the jorden mtr, you just need to exit and go straight up to the 5th floor and take your elevator back to the hotel. It's that fab! The cleaniness of the hotel is pretty incredible. Me and my friends are really messy people. So throughout the 4 nights at the prudential hotel, we always left it in a HUGE mess. Our clothes on the floor, things cluttered in the toilet and tables. But then everytime we got back, everything would be spick and span. They even rearranged all our toiletries, folded the discarded clothes that we threw on the beds, rearranged our luggage to accommodate more space.. I mean are they the best chamber maids or what?!! Also, the location is fantastic. Besides being above the jorden mtr, we were only one stop away from tsim tsa tsui, and 2 stops from mongkok. Plus we were surrounded by 7-elevens, and just behind the hotel is a stretch of street filled with odd shops perfect for any last minute clothing shopping. Its cheap plus, you are able to haggle for a lower price. Did i not forget to mention that the hotel is along the wonderful stretch of road called Nathan road? Just walk along it and i assure you, you'll find plenty to do and see. The area is also surrounded by many food stalls, and i would recommend getting yourself a nice roasted goose or pigeon. OR just walk over to temple street for some great food and shopping. As for the hotel room itself, i think the size is just right. The beds are comfortable, they even have bolsters provided!! Plus we got free complimentary bottled water per person every day. I'm not too sure if this is a compulsory option since my other two friends who stayed at the same hotel though 6 storeys lower, did not have any. But they did get free daily newspapers which we did not. I give this hotel 2 thumbs up. Totally worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: connoisseurc
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness: clean linen, clean bathroom Service: good service at reception plus concierge Location: directly above Jordan MTR with dedicated connecting exit, need to go up many sets of escalators to get into the hotel though Value: not bad, just under $200 per night Rooms: somewhat older but recently repainted, well sized

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Jona04
Reviews.Content: This hotel is much better than a few hotels I have stayed in. Clean and spacious (at least to me). I had once stayed in Dorsett Seaview which was a big mistake. Pros: It is convenient. The MTR is below the hotel. There are shops, a restaurant and even a gelato shop. There are many cafes and foot relax shops across from the hotel. Walking distance to Temple Street, Ladies Street and Avenue of Stars. Cons: To go up the hotel, you have to make your way up 6 levels of escalator. There is no lift. Not cool when you are lugging heavy luggage. I find the bed a tad hard.

Reviews.Title: “Very average - Not the best - Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: jpcdo
Reviews.Content: When I first checked in the executive room I was kind of pleased by the way the room looked, but to my horror when I checked the bed before I was going to sleep I found what looked like pubic hair on it, and a dead BED BUG!!! First I called the reception to ask them to change my sheets but then I decided to ask them to change room. After I did so, the new bed had hair on it, so I asked to see a manager this time and I got upgraded to the mezzanine suite, not so much of an upgrade because it was a smoking room and the mezzanine is not very convenient (I do not recommend for people with kids or old people), because you have to go up and down all the time since the bed is upstairs. Also it's very dangerous, you can hit your head very easily on those spiral stairs (which happened to one of us). The included breakfast is very average, it's good that it's included though. It was kind of ok until I found a hair in the pinapple, and heard heavy sneezing coming from the kitchen. The location of the hotel is ok, but not the best, it is near the Jordan MTR subway station, and you can walk in 15-20 to the Star Ferry, but being in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui is better. The pool on the roof is not so attractive, I don't think anyone really would want to swim in it. One good thing though, is the fact that internet was included in the executive room rate, which can save a lot of money knowing that a lot of hotels charge around 150HK$ for 24hrs. Overall I would not call this hotel a 4 stars but more a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Norway
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but very nice! Bathtub, nice desk, comfy beds and generally everything you need. Complimentary internet in the rooms is also a nice touch. The television is a bit wonky, but in a town like Hong Kong, who needs tv? I really recommend the late snack buffet in the hotel restaurant, GREAT food, and a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: mhchan38
Reviews.Content: I had a great deal booking it online. Great Location. The subway station is underneath the hotel. Buses are across the street. Distance from all shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Traveltosser
Reviews.Content: Probably fair for the price as Hong Kong is very expensive to stay in. I did expect it to be a bit nicer. It is a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value for money, superb location, highly efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: npenbloc
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great value for money, superb location, highly efficient and polite staff who responds to requests within minutes with typical Hong Kong efficiency - so efficient makes the Germans feel ashamed. Very very clean beddings and toilets. Run like an expensive Swiss clock. Makes you feel superbly safe and happy. Location superb, just ontop the centrally located Jordan subway station, so whole of Hong Kong and Kowloon just minutes away, literally at your feet! Quick check in, quick check out. Only grouses are: no free mineral water in rooms, and room-based wireless broadband access sucks, business office internet rates exorbitant. wireless broadband access in rooms cannot support computers running Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: lollypoplady
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a Good location right beside the Jordan subway stop.A bus from the airport will also take you to the door basically. Hotel is in Nathan road and is only a few Mins walk from The harbour and some large malls. Also to the star Ferry. Hotel was comfortable,clean and in good condition.No noise in room even though located on Nathan Road. The rooms were quite large and modern and there was a widescrean tv with some english channels. near a pacific coffee company cafe which is good for breakfast and free internet. To get to this and harbour head left at nathan road when you leave the hotel. The staff seemed friendly. There is also a pool on the roof but can be closed a bit due to the many thunderstrom warnings in the summer. Overall good stay and great value. Wold stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Petei2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at the Prudential on a stopover en route to Bali. The hotel is easy to get to from the international airport either by Airport Express train and hotel shuttle or thye A21 bus service. Situated directly above Jordan MTR station it is ideally situated for visiting all areas of Hong Kong. It is also just twenty minutes walk down Nathan road to the Star Ferry pier and two streets away from Temple Street night market. The check in and check out was efficient, Room well appointed and clean with a comfortable bed. Bar a pleasant place to spend and hour or so after sightseein. Breakfast superb with a choice of eastern and western fare (and crispy bacon!!!) The rooftop swimming pool is open during the summer months. We would certainly have no hesitation in staying at the Prudential again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Accomodations, Convenient Location, Affordable Price!”
Reviews.Author: cloudiedays
Reviews.Content: So far I've stayed here 3 times and I don't mind it. It's near the Jordan MTR station. I never get out of the exit w/in the hotel. I've learned that long, hard, tiring lesson. It's just easier to exit the regular street way. Not only is it close to an MTR station, it's also convenient with it's bus and mini-bus routes. It's the basics, but it's fine since it's just my place to sleep. If you're looking for more frills, you're probably not going to find it here. This is a 2-3 star hotel. I've been in similar rated hotels and they were much smaller. Some places don't always have unless requested, but they always do: a fridge and blow dryer. It has a fridge stocked w/some drinks. They left space for you to go out and stock your own in there. I usually go to Watson's or 7eleven and get a big bottle of water to polish off. It's 1 stop from TST and it's walkable. The views are alright. It's alright if you get the front/Nathan side of the rooms. If you get the back, you get a wonderful cultural view of Hong Kong. Didn't bother me much because I always like the shades closed anyway. A little mini bonus for me is riding the glass elevator at nite. You get to checkout some of HK's glitzy lights against the nite sky as you take your ride. Their gym is only a couple of machines, but who's here to workout and live in the hotel. The area is so convenient that when I opted for some physical fitness, I jogged in the park nearby in the morning and then all the way to the waterfront area. The staff is somewhat helpful. Luckily I don't require much help, but when I did have a few questions, it was hard to find someone (when it was early in the morning) or get a proper understanding to my question. It's across the street (the back area) from a 7eleven and a the yummiest shu mai/chinese crepe stand (good breakfast). Downstairs is a mall, across the street is a few stores, the next block is more stores. If you have a shopping condition to which you need to spend all the time, you won't have that problem here.

Reviews.Title: “great spot”
Reviews.Author: tonynannb
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights we were early so had to wait till room ready which is fine but then when got room was twin bed not double they said all doubles gone but room was good clean comfy beds and pillows breackfast was great internet to dear no water free great location for market and with the mrt underneath hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: Con96
Reviews.Content: Con Sydney, Australia Stayed at the Prudential Hotel , Nathan Road Hong Kong for 5 nights, as we required 2 rooms due to having our 2 tenage children with us, we were given rooms next to each other as i requested at time of booking,we were on the 15th floor with good street views of Nathan Road. Both rooms were cleaned daily by a very polite cleaner, who would always greet us in the mornings . The pool came to good use especially comming back from shopping and sight seeing as the weather being hot and humid. Check in went smoothly and our luggage was taken to our room by the Porter. At the time of check-in i requested a late checkout for 7pm, and reception was very accomadating to the request. Booked a couple of tours from the tour desk by Emily , who was a very cheerfull person and who was very helpfull . Location wise, you cannot ask for a easier place to stay, the Jordan MTR is located directly under the hotel for easy access to nearby suburbs and Disneyland . There is a HBC Bank located 3 doors down. Temple Street markets is about a 7 minute walk , and a seven 11 on the next corner. Also in the same building is a shopping center. As i work for an airline i would recomend this hotel to my work friends and family friends, as i have no complaints about this hotel and when i visit Hong Kong again i will definately be staying at the Prudential Hotel. As i mentioned earlier we were a family of 4 , we stayed in the Executive Rooms , my room had a King Size bed. and my 2 teenage children had two twin beds next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the facilities were a little outdated”
Reviews.Author: rangerfan23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night here during a stopover on our journey back to the UK. The hotel was very easy and inexpensive to get to, we just took the A21 bus which had a stop directly in front of the hotel. Upon checkin, we were told the hotel was full and we were upgraded to a suite. Due to the lack of time we could spend in Hong Kong, we did not stay in the hotel for a long period of time. We found the Prudential Hotel a perfect location for getting around the city easily. It is located above the Jordan station which can connect you to Hong Kong Island. The rooms were a little outdated, but the bed was the most comfortable thing we had slept on during our two week travels. The room was clean and provided incredible views off the balcony of the city. The only thing we found really disappointing was the business centre which charged was too much for only 30 minutes of internet usage. Even the wifi in the room was not complementary, it came at a charge. That was fine for us because we were not on a business trip, but those who are should be aware of the outrageous charges. If we ever head back to Hong Kong, I think we would stay here if the price was the same.

Reviews.Title: “It has it all--location--large room--amenities”
Reviews.Author: Cathyecuador
Reviews.Content: As a college graduation present I took my 22 year old niece to Hong Kong. Neither of us had previously been to Hong Kong. We loved our stay at the Pruton Prudential Hotel. The location to the Jordan Station MTR and the Temple Street Market was fabulous. The room was spacious and spotless with excellent service by all staff members. We really enjoyed the roof-top pool. Excellent reasonably priced restaurants fill the neighborhood. Unless you want to party late into the night in SODO, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: doggins25
Reviews.Content: This place has everything you'd expect from a plush hotel But we found getting any tourism information impossible, and their internet is too expensive so you're pretty much on your own when you get there The room and facilities are great though, actually better than expected Would have had a better overall rating if staff were more helpful but if you get a decent price for a room then its a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: deep_drr
Reviews.Content: Convenient location Easy to move around ! Great shopping ! Good business service !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: melbgirl123
Reviews.Content: Great location and great value hotel. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price”
Reviews.Author: kevincognito
Reviews.Content: It was a first trip to Hong Kong and after much research we decided on the Prudential for its location and price. It was close enough to walk to the harbour in 20 minutes or a bour a 5 minute subway ride which was a couple bucks. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance and the shopping neearby is endless. The rooms are larger than expected after reading many reviews af all the hotels ion Hong Kong. There was plenty of room for 2 suitcases and 2 can easily be in the bathroom at the same time. The restaurant was above average for breakfast but don't buy it with the hotel reservation as we got a 2 for 1 coupon once we were there. For Dinners we ate outside of the hotel as there were far too many choices for less money. We took the airport express and shuttle bus from the airport and it was a breeze. However, the ruturn trip shuttle bus does not stop at this hotel so you either have to get a taxi back to Kowloon station or right to the airport. There was four of us travelling so it was the same cost to take a taxi as it was for the epxress train. A travel note... We have discovered that the Hop On/Hop Off bus tour in all the major cities we have been to is a great way to get your bearings in a new city and from there you can jump off and on to discover your favourite areas more in depth. Also, with this pass you jump the line at the Peak tram over on the island which can save you an hour at least in a line up. Overall, we would definatley stay here again. In our opinion, to pay an at least an extra $100 a night is not worth it to stay down by the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and no fuss!”
Reviews.Author: girlwithsweets
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 years ago, booked through asiarooms.com and the rates were actually better than on the hotel website (at the time!). Location: Good, right on top of the subway. It isn't the poshy end of town though lol Views: uh, not much - some neon signs out the Rooms: smallish but clean and comfortable. Security cameras in the corridors and lifts. Flat screen TVs. Foyer: Very stylish, but if you have big luggage - bad luck! There was a tiny one 'lane' escalator to get to the lifts so it was a slight struggle. No bell boy. Internet: There's a business centre, but paying for internet in HK? Pfft - walk a few hundred meters and you get wifi or real cafes with free net everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: lpool9
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor recommendations. It wasn't spectacular and it wasn't horrible. It was pretty no-frills ... room looked a little tired and could use some updating. Was disappointed that internet was so costly. Breakfast was a great deal - HK$99 for 2 people ... about US$12 for 2. Nothing to rave about, but nothing major to complain about. This place serves the purpose. If you're not going to be in your hotel too much anyway - we weren't - it's a fine choice. Convenient to the Metro and was easily accessible to / from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: gForce94
Reviews.Content: This has been my best hotel experience ever. The rooms, the service, the spa, everything. The staffs specially were very polite and couteous. Its located in the busiest street of hong kong,both for tourists and business. Best thing is the price. For the price of a 2star hotel. Way very cheap compared to other 4 and 5 stars in the same location. Also at the basement of the hotel there is Jordan Station. Metro rail. So going around is convinient. Sajid UAE

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jackiestar
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 8.30pm, very easy to check in went up to room which stank of smoke, when back down to check in desk, took a short while to get a non smoking room, which we finally did, what a big differnce. Had some nice complimentry fruit in room on arrival.Room looked out over Nathan street. This was definately a great location. Right at the start of Nathan street near side streets where you could eat the local cusine outside in the hussle and bustle of walking traffic. Handy to catch the trains.

Reviews.Title: “Pruton Prudential Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Hintpod
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week in March at the Prudential Hotel and found everything to our liking. Our deal had breakfast included which we found had a great selection, (The omletes were real Good). Our room was very suitable and well serviced. The Bar Lounge and resturant were handy if you wanted to dine in. The food was to our liking. The hotel was central in Nathan Road and the rail was right at the door including buses. All the staff were helpful. Would stay at the Prudential again. Ron & Dianne Gold Coast. Queensland Australia

Reviews.Title: “what a city, what a hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maija80
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel with good location..rooms are clean and roomsize is good. jordan MTRstation was under the hotel.breakfast was good and we got it 990HKD/2 persons. in hotel is disney's ticketshop where you can buy cheap tickets to disneyland.near the hotel(behind) tak hing street is good restaurant called "king 1" it's cheap and sweet and sour pork is there so good!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: frequentflier606
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a five night stay at the prudential. The hotel is in a great location on Nathan road. We got the a21 bus from the airport for $33 which drops off right outside the hotel. It is also directly above the jordan MTR station which makes everywhere easily accesible. I booked our stay thorugh lastminute.com and got a really good rate. Check in was easy, we arrived early and the desk staf where more than happy to let us check in early, they where very freindly and helpful and where very keen to make pleasant conversation. We had a kingsize room and the bed was enormous and was really soft and comfortable. If I had one complaint though the room was a little on the small side and there wasn't much room for luggage. The bathroom was fine and the room was very clean and everything was in good order. There was a special 2 for 1 offer on breakfast in the hotel restaurant, it worked out about £4.50 per person and was excellent value. There was a good selection of western and eastern items and plenty of coffee too. The table staff were excellent. Only one compliant on the breakfast buffet was the inconsiderate, arrogant and rude italian business men who were using it at the same time. But a bit of British charm solved that situation and they where never seen again. The location is perfect. Its 5 mins walk to temple st night market (we ate there every night in temple st spice crab), 15 mins to the harbour front. As I mentioned before its on the Jordan MTR station so everywhere is easy to get to. Overall we had a great stay and would defiantely stay there again if we returned to Hong Kong. I'd recommend my own mother to stay there so you can't say more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Will beback”
Reviews.Author: belindaSingapore
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at hotel on friend's recommendation & after reading the reviews. Indeed, it was a breeze taking the A21 bus (only HKD33 each) from the airport to the hotel doorstep. Room was a comfortable size & quiet. Location is excellent. You can find many eateries offering wanton noodles, seafood, dim sum, desserts etc in the Jordan area (Pilkem, Parkes, Woosung) just opposite the hotel. Ladies market is within walking distance, one MTR station away. Also, shopaholics should not miss checking out Granville Road nearby. Jordan station just below hotel means easy access to Central & Causeway Bay on Hong Kong Island.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: SGlady
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Prudential for 3 nights and was given the 14th floor. Got a very good deal from booking.com at HKD 500 per night. Was given a queen-sized bed, with bathtub. Tea-making facilities and safe in room. The MTR was right beneath the hotel and was very accessible to many places. The Jordan station could lead us to Central, Tsim Sha Tsui, etc... Had a shopping mall right beneath. Staff spoke english and was helpful. There's a travel agency which sells Ocean Park and Disneyland tics. Got a good deal for the Disneyland, only HKD 295 per adult, instead of HKD 350 at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money if you get our special price”
Reviews.Author: Kirstin13
Reviews.Content: I booked it shortly in advance and got a very good rate for such a proper hotel. Nice room (interrior) with window and all amenities. But we were not able to switch on the heating and TV on our own and were to lazy to ask for help. Coffee shops around the area for breakfast. MTR station in the same building directly in the main street of Kowloon with a lot of shopping and also local restaurants. Good area to stay in and you can see many tourists on the streets but still feel like in real HK.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, efficient and friendly service, nice room at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Blu_Rock
Reviews.Content: A centrally-located hotel that sits directly above the Jordan MTR station. The A21 bus from the HK International Airport (HK$33) drops you off right at the front door and check in was efficient and pleasant. The room was well appointed and the bed was very comfortable and not too firm, unlike the hard matresses that I have slept on in mainland China. The buffet breakfast (HK$100 with in-room voucher) was pretty average and you could do better elsewhere. Left luggage was efficiently managed and secure with bags roped together and stored under netting. About 15 TV channels on offer (mainly Chinese langauage, but a couple of English and Japanese stations) as well as in-house movies. Complementary fruit and water (2 of each), tea and coffee facilities and a stocked minibar. My room (1012) over looked Nathan Rd. While my room was not that large (nor tiny), it was clean, fresh (even though it was a smoking room) and was more than adequate. Reasonably-priced at about US$100.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TLeung
Reviews.Content: The Prudential Hotel is ideally located, it is situated amongst the hustle and bustle of Kowloon's shopping and eating district. Being located above the Jordan MTR station makes this hotel so convenient, which was especially important for us as we were traveling with our 10 month old daughter. We stayed for 10 days before heading back home to NZ. The rooms are bigger than the average Hong Kong hotel room. Our room had the most enormous King size bed and still managed to comfortably fit a baby cot (which the hotel provided on request), a small couch and a desk (which had the mini bar fridge in it). The staff cleaning staff were very friendly and kept the room nice and clean each day. The reception desk staff were ok. We got a free newspaper and free bottled water each day. Even though the hotel is located above the MTR and is on a main road (Nathan Rd) it is nice and quiet. We didn't bring a laptop, if you need to use the internet don't use the one in the hotel business centre unless you don't mind paying HK$50 for 15 minutes of use. We booked on Wotif.com and hence got a really good deal. Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - highly reccommended!”
Reviews.Author: bec9
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 4 nights stay at the prudential. We couldn't fault this Hotel. Booked it on booking.com and paid on arrival. Dont pre-pay breakfast via website or travel agent as they had a 2 for 1 special when we arrived which saved quite a bit of money. The breakfast was lovely and kept us going all day. Room was spacious and clean. paper was delivered free each day (in english). We were also given free bottles of water daily. Toiletries supplied included soap, shower gel, shampoo, toothbrush/paste, comb, shower cap. Location was very central to shops, MRT , buses, markets. We got the bus (A21) from the airport for only $33HK and it stopped right outside the hotel (prudential centre bus stop on nathan road). We got an airport shuttle back to the airport for $105HK each simply because we had a lot more luggage. The airconditioning only seemed to have one temperature setting (cold) but it was no problem to get extra blankets on request (also pillows). we got an octopus card for all transport. $150HK purchased from the MTR ticket sales booth next to the tourist information booth as you walk out of customs. we requested a higher level and they put us on floor 12 - it was very quiet. We also asked for and got a 2pm late checkout for free. great hotel, would stay here again. only disappointment was that the pool was shut as it does every year in winter.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Comfortable hassle free stay.”
Reviews.Author: NatalieLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Prudential Hotel, Hong Kong. We booked 2 Executive rooms (5 travelling) through Expedia including breakfast and free WiFi Access (although we didn't use this as we didn't bring a laptop). The rooms were an ok size; 1 room with 2 single beds was comfortable and relatively spacious; 2nd room, adding a third single bed meant it was a little cramped, but still ok for a 4 night stay. Bathroom was average size, good powerful shower, and hotel provided a selection of amenities, shampoo, shower cap, toothbrush etc.... Tea and coffee making facilities were provided, as well as a small mini bar (not sure of prices, but there is a 7eleven just round the corner, which we used). Overall room was very clean, Tv with several english channels and beds were comfortable. Check in was quick and easy; reception staff were helpful and friendly. We went to reception several times to change some large notes and request extra blankets/bath robes and towels. The air conditioning was on throughout the hotel despite it actually being rather cool outside, we were able to turn it off in the room but we couldn't turn it onto heat. The rooms did get rather cold at night, so we requested extra blankets. The hotel is right above Jordan MTR station, so it was really easy to travel around Hong Kong. It's only about a 15min walk down to the Harbour, where you can get the Star Ferry over to Hong Kong Island. There are plenty of shops along and offNathan road, including a Starbucks, McDonalds, and local bakeries. It is pretty close to Kowloon park, a short walk to The Hong Kong museum of history/science museum and the Elements mall (although we never went there) is also close by. The breakfast buffet was varied, they had a selection of cereals, fruit, yoghurts as well as hot food, which usually included hash browns, baked beans, sausges and scrambled eggs. They also had an omelette station. Tea/cofffee, juice, pastires etc..Breakfast was served between 6:30-10:30, but anyone arriving after 10 did get a funny look from the head waiter as he checked his watch, LOL! but it's fine some people walked in as late as 10:30 some mornings. We took a taxi straight to the hotel from the airport, which cost us HK$300 (about £30), the airport bus does stop right outside (A21) or you can take a train to Jordan station. Just like the London underground there are steps, so not ideal if you have a lot of luggage and the MTR gets very busy at certain times during the day. Internet access from Hotel business centre was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “No Shampoo!!! Good location, avg hotel.”
Reviews.Author: albutt27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 nights with a break in between. We had free airport shuttle vouchers we used to transport us to the hotel. The hotel sits on Jordan MTR. Check in was quick and painless. The hotel room was very basic. I travel for a living, having earned Hilton Diamond, Starwood Elite status - and this hotel was no where in comparison. It had a bed which was pretty hard. The room was relatively spacious for HK. Upon seeing the bathroom, I couldn't believe they did not supply the room with shampoo. It was a soap dispenser. Excuse me?! What happened to the little bottles? Well I found out that some rooms get them if you pay more. How cheap can they get?! I took some from the maid who was very kind. So depending on how you book your room, will determine if you get soap/shampoo or not. Internet was extremely expensive. I walked over to the McD's for free internet. Overall the hotel is in a great location but I'm not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best time I had in Hong Kong this hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: newindian
Reviews.Content: Hi, We booked this hotel thru travelocity.co.in. It took 25 minutes for us to reach from airport to hotel thru airport shuttle service they charged 110 Hong kong dollars per person fare. Shuttle will leave you in front of yr hotel and you do not even have to carry your heavy luggages as they do all this for you. Taxi charges are 220 to 270 depending on traffic to the hotel. If you are travelling in a group of two or more its better you choose taxi instead of shuttle service. The MTR is in underground you do not have to go out of hotel, just take lift frm your hotel room and then few esclators down you can board MTR to travel anywhere any place in hong kong. Octopus card is very important get it the same day you start your day in hong kong. Its available at all mtr stations. You can buy drinks pay bills , pay for bus tickets , can buy entry tickets to several attractions just by using one octopus card . IF you are in hong kong for atleast 3 days fill your card for 400 HKD. This will save your lots of time while buying and travelling. Hotel room was quite good and we requested room with city view. One can request room with city view at the time of checkin. But .. room with city views are with twin beds and rooms with king size beds are without city view. Internet is very costly in this hotel. They charge 50HKD for just 15 minutes time. Good news is that you can surf free of cost in all MTR stations. computers with free internet access are avialable in maximum MTR stations. SO NO NEED TO PAY 50 HKD FOR INTERNET SURFING. The beds are small in size. Bathroom neat and clean. Towels clean bathtub was small water pressure in bathroom EXCELLENT Tea kettle in room ac worked fine bedsheets were clean BUT YOU WILL HEAR SOUNDS ALL THE TIME FROM OTHER ROOMS AS WELL AS FROM STREET. very noisy rooms electronic safe in room mini bar with high pricing pay movies avialable HOTEL STAFF OTHER THAN ON RECEPTION DO NOT UNDERSTAND ENGLISH. Location is extremly great No need to take mtr for light show, science museum , space museum, night market. they are all just few min walking distance from hotel. walking distance to the light show. science museum space museum ladies night market AT THE TIME OF CHECKIN YOU WILL BE ASKED TO PAY 500 HKD deposit for mini bar and pay movies that is refundable on checkout. Gym extremly small I will not say the hotel is the best among all i think you can get better hotels for the same price. It was not very attractive for the price we paid. Hong kong has several MTR stations so i am sure any hotel you book in tsim sha tsui will be near to MTR. Don't book this hotel just b'coz the MTR is underground. ALL HOTELS IN TSIM SHA TSUI are near MTR. I will not recommend this hotel . I booked just b'coz the mtr was underground. its not that attractive and the beds are also small . the location is no doubt FANTASTIC but all hotels in tsim sha tsui are the best ! Internet surfing pricing is very high while some/MANY hotels offer free internet services. and are much near to many attractions . MY TIP : BOOK HOTEL IN TSHIM SHA TSUI its the best place to be in hong kong. Don't book this hotel if you are looking for quiet good stay. Only book this hotel when you get it for very cheap prices than other hotels in tsim sha tsui. If you need more information i will be happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, room & service”
Reviews.Author: oscar28
Reviews.Content: Stayed an enjoyable 3 days whilst taking my mother to visit relatives in HK. She is 83 years old and the front desk promptly gave us a room on the 12th floor nearest the lift. The duty manager also kindly extended our check-out on last day to match our flight times so my mother can rest before going to airport. We also had good help from the concierge so I don't really understand what the fuss was with other complaints about front desk on this website, perhaps our ability to speak Cantonese made a difference? The location of this hotel is excellent so even my 83 year old mother was using the HK MTR subway as this hotel is right above the JORDAN MTR station. Our room was a very reasonable size by HK hotel standards (you won't believe some of the rooms I stayed in other tourist hotels. There is a modern soft couch by the window facing an island desk where broadband PC facilities and power sockets are built into the desk. We are really impressed by the design of the circular island connected to the desk and housing the minibar fridge and also tea making facilities. Why don't all hotels design compact facilities like these when space is at a premium!? I think the hotel used a five star designer for the interior design so the renovation work was perfect. We did not use the restaurants and cafe in the hotel as we had lots of relatives entertaining us elsewhere. But looking at the crowd going in and out of the hotel facilities, I can only believe the outlets must be a reasonable standard as it has to compete with other outlets in the shopping center next door. We really rate this hotel very high in comparison to many other hotels we used in HK and we will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, clean room, rude bellhop”
Reviews.Author: sunnyvale_dude
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights end of June 2008. We arrived at 10 AM and still got our room, no questions asked (we were prepared to even leave our bags and head out till we can get a room, but this was just perfect after a 12+ hour flight). The friendly front desk staff even informed us we got a free upgrade on the room. The upgraded room was a tad larger than a "cozy" room (and big by HK standards), so we were glad we got that upgrade! IWe booked a bus tour through the travel desk and it was ok. The bellhop at the ground level was the only downside of our stay. They barely understood English and grimaced at us the four times we passed by them (including arrival and departure). The station right under the hotel made it so easy to get to places anytime during the day or night. It was crowded even at nights and seemed really safe. HK TIP #1 - If you have bags, TAKE THE TAXI from the airport. We took the airbus and had to lug our bags quite a bit. It was not fun! HK TIP #2 - Very few people speak English, and no one will stop to answer your questions or help with directions. Plan well!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: toadstrip
Reviews.Content: Great location for travel, all atractions close or very easy acsses buy rail. The hotel is nextdoor to rail, with very easy acsses and shopping mall. We came by boat from Macua and it was a short taxi ride from the termanal , but it is a easy train rid from airport. Great little bakery across the road if you dont like the hotels breaky and good value restarunts near buy. Had the seafood night at hotel, good and plenty to select from. Good clean stay would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “The best location!!”
Reviews.Author: vickyplumm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find and the staff were helpful. The room was really lovely and spacious, the best value for money we found in Hong Kong. It is also literally around the corner from the markets at Kowloon, we ate at the night market and shopped for trinkets every night after a hard day sightseeing! Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Taipeiworldlywise
Reviews.Content: on Kowloon side, very convenient to mtr at jordan station great for few night in HK staff: aloof room: very nice and comfortable pretty good value

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: christie79
Reviews.Content: I stayed there twice earlier this month and can only recommend the Prudential Hotel. After a 12 hour trip, I was quite glad to have an easy an quick check in, without mentioning a free upgrade to a deluxe room on 15th floor. My second stay was equally pleasant. Nice clean room, comfy bed, good bathroom with all the amenities. Very good location in Kowloon. I only had breakfast once through room service, though expensive the breakfast was really nice and tasty. The staff is quite nice and helpful. The concierge can keep your luggage after check out which is very convenient. I will definitely choose this hotel again if I ever return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel at 3 star prices”
Reviews.Author: msb1
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was excellent for the price. My deluxe room was a good size, on the 12th floor overlooking the Nathan Road. The bed was a huge queen size & very comfortable and you get complimentary bottled water, fruit & newspaper, downside was the price of drinks in the bar & the restaurant. I found reception & concierge very helpful. Hotel was in a great location - easy to get around. I would recommend getting the airport express train & bus connection, it drips you off just round the corner from the hotel, but the pickup point is further away so I got a taxi to Kowloon station for HK$25 I agree with other reviews to go to the Shamrock hotel for dim sum, theres an english menu with pictures (no prices) and some of the staff speak english. 3 plates of dim sum and tea came to HK$ 60 for one person. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel as I thought it was too expensive (HK$ 118 pp) instead I went to a great bakery opposite & picked up a few bits for just HK$10.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent stay. great location”
Reviews.Author: jessip
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here at the end of our honeymoon. We got an executive suite and it was a good size. I wouldn't call it big, but from what i have heard about hong kong hotels being TINY, i think it was probably quite big. Great bathroom and shower, massive comfy bed. Good high speed internet. Friendly staff. Great breakfast, although we only paid for one breakfast, and they wouldn't let us change the date of which we took it which was just nonsense. my husband got cross with them and they then let us, but it was so silly. Perfect location!!!!! Great shopping all around. Would highly recommend. Also you MUST eat at Crystal Jade. Its down by the water. Ask for directions. We did a lot of research on places to eat and this was BY FAR the winning place to eat. Good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Nota a memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: MemberfromPadova
Reviews.Content: I checked in late because of a delayed arrival. I was given a smoking room despite of my reservation for a non-smoking one. I called the reception to sort this out and they came to my room with a spray deodorant to cover the stale of smoke. Of course I did not accept ,and asked to be relocated to a different room. I was reluctantly given one which, however, had definitely not been dusted for a few days. Despite of this, and as most people say, the hotel enjoys an excellent location just over the “Jordan” subway station. This is a basic, no-frills hotel. You may pretend you are staying in an Ibis Hotel in Europe or a Days Inn in the US. Decent rooms, minimal and cheap furniture, thin walls. Restaurant serves the usual, nothing-special hotel food which is to be forgotten in general. The hotel can be recommended for its location and in the case you get a very good rate. Conversely, better options are plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: MM2H
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in early November. We arrived as notified at midnight and our preference for a king bedded room couldn't be met. We were told that the previous occupant hadn't checked out - hmm. However, they did offer to change our room the following day. This seemed like a pain so the next day we cancelled the change and kept the twin bedded room. Based on a previous reviewer's suggestion we asked for a high floor and were on the 12th, overlooking a small side street and it was surprisingly quiet. The only disturbance we had was from other guests being inconsiderately noisy in the corridor late at night. The room was small and furnished a bit like a TravelLodge in the UK and the bathroom was very tiny indeed but the bedding was very clean, the bed comfortable and the towels new although far too small! Daily room servicing was skimped a bit but acceptable for this grade of hotel. The public areas are in the style of a bad eighties night club - lots of glass, chrome and black and red but the location is unbeatable for convenience and in the few dealings we had with the staff, they were polite, knowledgeable and efficient. We didn't eat at the hotel or use any of the facilities as we were there to see the sights, shop and eat out. If you just want a clean and simple base with no frills but a convenient location on Jordan/Nathan, this is probably it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlred99
Reviews.Content: I agree with many previous reviews. The hotel is in a good location, right above the MTR stop. The rooms are kind of small and nothing to write home about. The surrounding area is not great either, but it is very close to the night market, the promenade and other tourist attractions. And the price was right at $120 USD per night. Only complaints - hotel staff was rude to us on many occasions.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Strump
Reviews.Content: Great Location, on top of MTR subway makes it handy for getting around and shopping, good sized clean room for HK, helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice accomodation”
Reviews.Author: sailorann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prudential Hotel from October 1- October 10th. The hotel is located very centrally right above Jordan MRT. This was a great locatIon as it was only a few minutes away from Temple Street Market and also Central station. We had booked an executive suit which included breakfast. Upon check in the staff were very friendly and checked us in immediately. We were provided our meal vouchers for the breakfast meal. The buffet was good and had both east and western foods. Not a huge selection, but it was still good. The staff there were also very courteous and friendly. Our room was very nice and modern. The view was great, overlooking Nathan road! The hotel had a roof top pool and oberservation deck. Very handy for those humid days. Overall we had a very nice stay at this hotel. The shuttle bus from the airport dropped us right off and we found it easy to get around. Would recommnend staying in this area verus the golden mile stretch, as it is more central and not as touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Airport bus A21 right in front”
Reviews.Author: danielakorem
Reviews.Content: Stayed there end Sept. for 4 nights. I had some misgivings after reading the reviews, but the location+price won, and I'm happy to report that everything was OK, starting with the bus straight from the airport, without having to change and wait for a free shuttle, and then, again, we just crossed Nathan rd. on the other side, and in a few minutes we had A21 back to the airport, the journey taking about 50 minutes. You get to see the city and it was very handy and great ! Night market - 7 min. walk. Ladies' market - 20 min easy walk. Star Ferry - also between 15-20 min walk. At the beginning we used the MTR with the Octopus, but we found the air conditioning freezing, and a lot of walking in & between the stations, so whenever possible - we walked. Breakfast - sushi, dim sum, scrambled eggs per request - worth the money, since, personally, I hate to wake up in the morning & search for a place for breakfast, and either they speak poor English, or I couldn't understand what they were saying... Worth the money !!

Reviews.Title: “Well, it depends on your purpose in coming to HK....”
Reviews.Author: scubawun
Reviews.Content: Great location on Tsim Sha Tsui. Jordan MTR (subway) is directly below the hotel so access is perfect. Cabs are easy to get. If you are going to be out shopping and eating and shopping and eating and sightseeing and just need a clean nice room to rest your tired legs, this is it. If you need a fancy hotel, this is not it. Room rates are reasonable and the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great accessibility to Public Transport”
Reviews.Author: ZOOC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Prudential Hotel with my mum for 5 nights in a twin deluxe room. I must say that the hotel is perfectly located to close proximity to public transport with a bus stop right outside the hotel/shopping plaza and the Jordan MTR right underneath. As previously mentioned by other guests, the best way to access the MTR is via the street entry/exit on Nathan Rd and not the Prudential Hotel entry/exit as there are about 5 levels of escalators to go up to reach the hotel entry. The deluxe room we stayed in was bigger than I expected. I have read lots of reviews of hotels and have heard that Hong Kong rooms are smaller than the average Australian hotels and I wasn't expecting that much. We had a view of Nathan Rd but surprisingly I didn't notice much noise from the traffic below, which I was a bit worried about. Though, being on the 11th floor that might of helped a bit. The room was quite clean and the beds weren't too hard by HK and China standards. We were provided with 2 complimentary bottles of water as well as some treats such as kit kats, cereal drink and a banana. The bathroom was the only disappointment as the toilet seemed to be kind of block with the water being 2/3 full (I'm not quite sure if this is a HK thing coz I found a public toilet the same way). Also, the bath was quite shallow and the shower curtain was quite dirty. The only aspect that I like was they provided toothbrushes and toothpaste, which I hadn't encountered in 4 or 5 star hotels. During our stay, we ordered room service. The service was quite efficient having our Unagi Don set served within 20 minutes. The gentleman who brought our meal was very friendly and had great manners. The food itself was beyond expectations and was just as good as how I experience it in Australia. I was disappointed in how we were offered free high speed internet only to find out this didn't include wireless (I only had my Ipod touch and weren't able to use their cable). You are able to access the wireless from your room but with an extra cost. They did however allow me to use their business centre free of charge. Overall, it was a great hotel considering the relatively affordable price we paid. I would definately recommend this hotel for all the budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: JPB08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for seven nights during the heat of September. The room was small but comfortable - there was a 'king bed' that was actually made up of two (?king) singles that did not really affect what the bed was like. It was very firm. There was a light doona (as opposed to a blanket), which was nice. The staff were lovely, with the housekeeping staff in particular being quite friendly and helpful. The hotel is located above Jordan station (MTR) and this was great! It meant that after a long, hot day out we just had to climb a few sets of escalators to get to the hotel (all under cover). We were also able to explore Nathan Road from right outside the hotel and it was about a fifteen minute walk to the harbour. Jordan station is close to Central and ideally located in relation to other lines. Overall, a very good hotel at a good price, with the location probably the best feature.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: doofygilmore
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family in Prudential Hotel for 4 nights in September 2008. The hotel is conveniently located on above the Jordan MTR station in Kowloon, so getting anywhere in Hong Kong is very convenient. Rooms are large by Hong Kong standard, and they are modern and clean (4-star standard). Everything was working and we rested well at night with no noise. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel (not included in the rate), so we used the recommendation of a reviewer on tripadvisor (thank you) and ate dim sum at Shamrock Hotel across the street on Nathan. The dim sum was fresh, delicious and not expensive. Check in/out was efficient and the staff were polite. From the airport, go on a Airport Hotelink bus which bring you directly to the hotel. Look for the Airport Hotelink counter at the arrival hall after you clear customs. The cost is HK$110 per person and the ride is about 1 hour. To return to the airport, arrange with the hotel concierge for the same bus service to pick you up from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tsiresy
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip and had to stop by in HK. Based on reviews, I choose its hotel for its location. Effectively, it is very well situed at the bottom of Nathan Road. So if you want to be in Kowloon, it is an excellent place to stay. However, although I found bed, TV and furniture fine, I had so much troubles with the bathroom: water not flowing, toilets blocked, hair dryer dropped into toilets, etc. Thus, it is good value for money, but not something exceptional. But for its price range, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiwiRedAuckland
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here on business and really enjoyed it. I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on this site and didn't regret it. The room was very comfortable and had a great view over Nathan Road. Temple St night market is five minutes walk up the road and the Jordan MTR is underneath the hotel for fast travel to anywhere else in Hong Kong. Breakfast catered for all tastes. Rooftop swimming pool is a bit small and closed for two hours during the day for maintenance but you can still relax on the rooftop on sun loungers. I found the staff very friendly. If you're going to the airport from the hotel, the best way is to get a taxi (very cheap) to Kowloon Station and you can check your luggage in here rather than the airport. It then takes only about 20mins to the airport and you don't have to wait around when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & will still be my next trip choice hotel”
Reviews.Author: milosuh
Reviews.Content: Indeed, like many other travellers whom had stayed at Prudential Hotel, the hotel is situated at a very good spot just along Nathan Road. There are plenty of eatry and shops are just at the doorsteps. The room is minimal but spacious in HKG standard. Can't asked for more. It will definitely my choice of stay for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaiseyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prudential for 2 nights on our way home after spending 4 weeks in Europe - after reading recommendations on this website - good value for money. Great position - located in Nathan Road over the Jordan Station. Caught the A21 bus from the airport ($HK33 each) which took approximately 1 hour but saw the sights on the way. Bus stopped outside the hotel. We arrived at 9.15am and were able to get into our room straight away - very pleasant reception staff. Great service by all staff although the Concierge was a little under pressure during the day and not as attentive to our enquiries. Lovely large room overlooking Nathan Road (amazing view of the streets at night) with shutters that darkened the room. Very spacious and comfortable bed. Very close to the Temple Street night market - great fun bartering. Breakfast not included in our price - only wanted a continental breakfast in the dining room but had to pay for a full breakfast. Better off ordering room service if you only want a continental breakfast. Ate in the dining room on our first night - nice meal but on the 2nd night went across the road to the Shamrock Hotel and had Dim Sum with a beer for $HK184 - great value and excellent food. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Inspection”
Reviews.Author: meowmel
Reviews.Content: Location On Nathan Rd MTR station (Jordan St) in the basement Connected to 6 storey mall Rooms Superior- King Bed, Day lounger, big bathroom, LCD TV, Desk. Deep purple colors used though-out very stylish Executive- Duplex style (mezzanine) glamorous glass winding stair case up to bedroom on mezzanine floor, king bed only thing was you need to go downstairs to use the bathroom Comments/Recommendations I really liked the décor in this hotel. Really nice lobby area with shiny black marble and desks etc. they had jazz music playing and was finished off with purple furnishings which flowed on to the rooms. It looked like it had recently had a soft refurbish (bedding) They had a small gym area and there roof top pool, was a length pool which would appeal to quite a few travelers. You could also go up from this area to an observatory tower which was something unique to the hotel Internet is also available (paid for at reception)

Reviews.Title: “My choice the next trip”
Reviews.Author: phansy90
Reviews.Content: Just came back today from a 5 nights stay at Prudential. It is exactly like what the earlier reviews said. Lovely place! I would stay at BP Intl Hse during my previous trips to HK. This time round, thought of having a change and chose Prudential based on the reviews here. Did not regret. We booked superior rooms through Travelocity, requested connecting rooms but did not get it when checking in. However, the recept was prompt and tried his darndest to get us the connecting rooms. Thanks Ray Sha! We have a child with us, so the red little couch was great. Previously at BP, our child had to share a bed with an adult. This time round, we parked the couch beside the bed, and perfect. I don't think I can fault the hotel at all. If I really have to pick, then it'll be the escalators leading to the recept. But, it doesn't matter a bit, the MTR Jordan Stn right under the hotel makes that up.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel for a family wanting to get out and about.”
Reviews.Author: AussiesX5
Reviews.Content: My three children and I stayed at the Prudential for 9 days. It was a great hotel for us. The Jordan MTR under the hotel made getting around so easy. The room was clean and comfy and the breakfast buffet set us up for a busy day of exploring. The staff were helpful and friendly. We had a view out to the buildings at the back but this was not a negative, we had sun in our rooms in the morning and enjoyed watching the activities in the buildings nearby.i.e. a movie being filmed on a rooftop and the daredevil bamboo scaffolders at work. I would stay in this hotel again if I came to Hong Kong. P.S. There is a very cheap laundry at the far end of the backstreet, and the Kamazaki bakery across the road in Nathan Rd is a great place for rolls, cakes and snacks at very affordable family friendly prices..

Reviews.Title: “Great location and huge room size (by HK standards )”
Reviews.Author: urbanmale_tods
Reviews.Content: We just return from our 4 nights stay at the Prudential Hotel. It was our third time in HK and decided to try out this hotel for the first time and was not disappointed. Prudential sits atop the Jordan MTR made travelling to TST, Mongkok and HK Island a breeze. Smack in the heart of Nathan Road, you are not far from all the shopping actions in TST or Mongkok. There are many shops and eateries around the hotel ( if not opposite ), especially the Satay King at the basement of the hotel. It is just so convenient that we often drop by our hotel to drop off our shopping bags and carry on from there again! We stayed in the Superior Room and are huge by HK Standards. We had 2 twin beds and a comfy red couch. Room is huge enough to accomodate one more bed i guess. Yes, they are clean but overly simple and bland decor . I also dislike the idea of escalators getting up to the hotel lobby, really troublesome especially if you have many luggage with you. Reception staff ( even an asst. supervisor ) offers cold and unfriendly service - a certain lack of smile. Apart from its prime location and room size, other aspects of the hotel barely could make it to 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Queenslander”
Reviews.Author: Queenslander008
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to my expectation as I was looking for a hotel with clean and comfortable room/beds, close proximity to the MTR and in a mid range price. All my expectations were satisfied. We booked the Earlybird package for a week, and found the room very clean and comfortable. Although not much of a view and limited TV channels, the convenience to the Jordan MTR, shops and reasonable price made up for it. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We caught the Airport Express (HK$90 each) to the Kowloon station and caught a taxi to the hotel (HK$30). We didn't have to eat at the hotel but instead tried the number of small local restaurants on the side street outside the hotel - so cheap and yummy. The only disadvantage is, their English is very limited. It rained most of the week we were in HK, but because the MTR is directly below the hotel complex, we didn't have to get wet when we ventured out to our daily shopping. For those of you who haven't travelled to Hong Kong before, don't forget to get an Octopus Card which can be used on all the public transport - very convenient to use and saves so much time going on the MTR. You can get a refund on any unused amounts at the Kowloon station.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneHappyone
Reviews.Content: The Pruton Prudential Hotel in Hong Kong offers excellent accommodation right in the middle of Nathan Road. We stayed in a deluxe room which was roomy, comfortable and very clean. Facilities included a good rooftop pool - but we didn't have time to use it! There is so much shopping and sight seeing to do. The buffet breakfast was tasty and offered a variety of dishes both western and asian, and good hot coffee. Staff were helpful and spoke passable english. I did a lot of research on hotels before we travelled to Hong Kong, I am extremely fussy in regard to cleanliness and ambience but the Prudential passed my standards with flying colours. The tour office girls arranged a great day tour for us at the last minute and were a good source of information. Make sure you sleep in though, as the shops do not open until after 10.00 am and some not until after 11.00 am, however you can shop into the night until 11.00pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Hotel I loved Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: yesimawake
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in nov 07 in a group The service was great, but there is no 24 hour room service and you are unable to get anything to eat after 11pm. The restaurant and bar were good, but very overpriced. We found a local bar to drink in just down the road instead of paying the high prices in the hotel and we met some very friendly locals who insisted we sing Karaoke songs songs with them (sorry Ronan Keating) The location is great with a metro station downstairs in the mall you are able to travel very quickly and easily anywhere in Hong Kong. Get an Octopus card from the metro station and top it up at the ticket machines. We were able to travel all over Hong Kong for a week for £10 on buses and trains and that includes the train to Disneyland. We ate at roadside cafes most of the time and a meal and drinks rarely came to £10 for two people. grab a business card from the front desk as it has the hotel address in Cantonese and english, it will help you if you ever need to get a taxi back to the hotel. The harbour light show is a must i think it was every night at 8pm The ferry to hong kong island was very easy to use and very cheap we thouroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel and i would definately recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: nurwono
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room and it's a huge room (for HK standards) that could accomodate 3 adults and 1 child. There was no need to get an additional bed for the third adult as the sofa could be used as a bed. The room was large enough for me to do some simple cooking for my 18-month-old toddler. On top of that, the location is excellent. Most places are easily accessilbe. i am very satisfied with the hotel. PS: Don't place much expectation on the the breakfast though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: angellily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location just a short walk to all the late night shopping and markets!!!!! The staff we friendly enough. I was put into a smoking room so woudl say if you dont want a smoking room state at time of check in. When I asked to change my room they were very willing and gave a king bed on the ninth floor. Nice room with everything in it.

Reviews.Title: “The Prudential Hotel, Kowloon Side, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: sfhearts
Reviews.Content: The last two times that I stayed in Hong Kong I stayed at the Prudential. The arrangements were made by my travel agent. I like this hotel because I can access the MTR directly without going outside into the streets. It sit on the Jordan Exit as one of many exits. Also I like the location. It is around local shops and restaurants that I like to try out. The rooms are nice and clean. I am not too picky about my rooms at longs as there is WiFi, a table and a bed. :) You have to pay for WiFi. I don't mind. I pay for the 3 day usage 300HK dollars. Since I am afraid of heights I don't like their elevators. It has those from-the-floor-to-top glass that allows you to see the street below as you zoom up! It is not entirely of glass - just about a person and a half width if they were standing close to each other.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: ClaireeTurnip
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room to use for a few hours before our flight home. The location of the hotel is ideal for being in the centre of things in HK. We found the room to be clean, tidy and comfortable. Although we only used the room in the afternoon and early evening, there appeared to be quite a bit of noise from the surrounding rooms and the corridor so not sure if this would disturb your sleep or not thorough the night. All in all, it seemed like a fairly decent hotel, not sure if I'd rate it as a 4* though as a lot of the paintwork needed a tidy up. Overall though, it was perfectly fine for what we needed and would seem like a good base for exploring the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Average choice...”
Reviews.Author: IneseJurevica
Reviews.Content: I think you can make an effort in finding something more attractive. The hotel is well located, perfect in terms of transportation. Beginning of Kowloon, where it is standing, might seem a bit of a mess and a lot of noise, but that is the local flair. The night market is in 2 blocks, the subway is down the escalator, the Avenue of stars is 15 minutes by foot (could be closer!). The room was spatious, though in decent quality, but there is a worn out feeling. The service is good, the reception personnell is not very welcoming. Anyhow, I would say it is an average choice. I would rather look at the other bank of the river.

Reviews.Title: “great for location”
Reviews.Author: cute-baby-angel
Reviews.Content: hey there, i've just come back after a three week stay here at the prudential hotel first thing first, everyone keeps going on about the escalators...well i can confirm...you do not need to carry your luggage yourself!!! all you do is, go to the concierge, and when you check out, ring the concierge again. BUFFET is [--]!!! pardon the french!! but i've had better buffets elsewhere and not to mention the macdonalds is even nicer...and you get more selection so give the buffet a miss! i booked it at $780 per night plus 10 % service charge and 3 % government tax, approx £60 a night the lobby is ok size, there's 4 escaltors to your room levels...be warned in hot weather the two glass lifts are humid!!! room size (i booked a twin room) was great, got a little red sofa as well, got a tv, air con, desk, bathroom, was radther basic...something like in a travel lodge here in uk... location is brilliant!!! right on top of the JORDAN MTR, exit E, you just go to the top of the shopping centre to get to your hotel, laundry's just a few yards from the hotel, and the 7/11 convinience store...we was not given any free water!!! but be warned the escaltors to the shopping centre...to get to the mtr doesn't work from like 10pm- 10am at the very base of the hotel (shopping centre) they do the most amazing ice creams!! try the guava flavour and the yakult flavour

Reviews.Title: “A decent size room with thin walls and little service”
Reviews.Author: lazybape
Reviews.Content: Im from HK so this is my view on the hotel. I don't believe I have very high standards and I know space is limited. We stayed at the Prudential hotel for about a week. It was located on top of the MTR(subway) so it was very convenient. To get to the MTR just go down to the escalators and into the mall to level 2B or if you go outside theres an entrance across the street. But if you are going to HK to party in places such as lang kwai fong or causaway bay you might want to find a place on the other side of the island. MTR closes around 12:45am so any time after that you will have to take a taxi back to the hotel running around 80 to 100hkd ($10-15usd). This is the down side. The room looked modern to me but the walls are VERY thin. I ended up hearing little kids in the morning starting at 6am EVERY morning (im not even joking) and at night I heard people making love from ACROSS the hall. At one point there were people smoking on the non smoking floor. Originally I booked a single bed which turned out to be two twin on the first night. When asked will there be a single bed room available tomorrow, the reply was I don't know and made no effort to try to find out. We later went through a few staff between the two days before we could get the room change. They tried to offer us a room with two twin bed which they would pull together on a smoking floor with we declined. The silk throw pillows on the bed were cute until I found little unknown stains on them. The red chair in our room for the desk was BADLY stained. Overall it was simple room. Only I got a rash during my stay there. Which magically disappeared after we had left. As for people who had commented on Mong Kok be close. It is very close but if you are looking for tourist attractions such as Flower Market or Woman Market, those places closes around 11pm. We had paid around 100usd a night which you could probably find a better place just as convenient on the other island such at Metropark in Causeway or Wesley. If one is really so incline to living in Kowloon area, BP International which my mother had stayed in is suppose to be decent. I did not hear complaints of dirty linens or thin walls. BP is actually the chose of my mother when she goes back every year. Even though it is conveniently located, I would not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK but terrible bed/s”
Reviews.Author: msMelburnian
Reviews.Content: The room was a reasonable size for HK with (short) King bed and small sofa. Flat screen LCD TV (but TV in HK is terrible if you don't have satellite, which Pruton doesn't). Small bathroom but everything was spotlessly clean so no complaints. Water pressure was great and water was HOT in a nanosecond! Complimentary bottled water (x2) replaced daily was nice touch as the tap water is ordinary. Bed was rock hard. Literally. The mattress had no give whatsoever. My back was seizing up after 2 days and it was impossible to get a restful nights sleep. Lots of tossing and turning. I think the hotel really needs to look at upgrading or atleast adding retro-fit "pillowtops" to soften the blow. Blockout curtaining could help too especially for rooms facing Nathan Road (the hotel opposite lights up at night like a Christmas tree). Location is very good. Directly above Jordan MTR (exit E & up a few floors via escalator). Alternatively you can catch the free shuttle (K1) from Kowloon Airport Express station that drops you around the corner just off Nathan Road. Turning right into Tak Shing Street (Giordano on the corner) takes you to the hotels side entrance & lobby. A 15-20 minute walk down Nathan Road to Star Ferry terminal. The hotel is on top of a shopping mall housing mainly clothing retailers and a few tailors. Basement level has a restaurant and gelato bar but there are better options for dining elsewhere. For those who need to know, there are 2 Macdonalds and a Starbucks within 500 metres. Better coffee (very popular with "Westerners") at the Pacific Coffee Co. opp Parkland Shoppers Blvd near Kowloon Park in Nathan Rd- they also have free internet for customers. The Yamazaki bakery opposite the hotel does some pretty good stuff including egg tarts. They take Octopus Card too which is the best thing since sliced bread. The Hong Kong Hotels Assoc rates this hotel as 4-4.5 star. In my opinion it's a 3 star at best. Don't be fooled by the star rating in any event.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nickel69
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Prudential Hotel from 25/01/08 to 27/01/08 - 3 days 2 nights. Hotel is conveniently located just above Jordan station. You would have to take the escalators from the main entrance to reach the hotel lobby. Staff at the front desk were helpful but no smiles. In fact, the bell-boy who brought our stuff up was more cheerful. We had two inter-connecting rooms for a family of 5. Rooms are very clean, sufficiently big enough even though we had 3 huge lugguages in one of the rooms. Bath rooms are small but no complaints. There is a small shopping center connected to the hotel. Shops are mostly selling ladies clothes, shoes etc. As our stay do not include B/F, morning meals were bought from nearby bakeries or "Cha Chang Ting". This was a plus point as we have 2 smalll children who loves noodles and porridge for breakfast. There is also a McDonald's and Starbucks around the corner. A few streets down at Pilkem Street, there is the Yee Shun Milk Co. (know for its steamed milk) and a dessert shop know as "Tang Yuan Huang" (tried the glutinous rice ball in black sesame paste). Lots to see at Temple Street (ten minutes walk from hotel). Unfortunately, my wife and myself couldn't go far as it was raining on the night when we went to Temple Street. Overall stay - comfortable and would not mind returning again to Prudential Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, nice room, uncomfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: wavingcat
Reviews.Content: We arrived by Airport Express and then the free shuttle bus from Kowloon Station, which stopped a block down the road (I would have found it hard to find the hotel had a friend not met us!). It is a bit confusing getting into the hotel too from the MTR, if you take the exit marked "Prudential Hotel" (up many escalators, and then the signs suddenly stop). It's best to take the MTR exit "Fourseas Building", and turn right - the hotel is right in front of you in Tak Shing Street. The concierge desk were really helpful, but as noted by an earlier review, the lobby staff were not as nice, unsmiling and a bit short with us. The room was a good size and clean, we got a twin bed on a non-smoking floor, and when we ran into housekeeping they were really friendly and nice. The only trouble we had was with the lights/ electricity (you put your keyfob in a slot to activate the electricity). It was all or nothing - all lights on, all the time, or no lights at all (and therefore no electricity to charge your phone, etc, whilst you sleep)! Also a bit challenging when you want to go to the toilet at night. Also, they were doing some renovations on our floor, so trying to rest during the day was iffy. The area of the hotel (Jordan, in TST) was OK - the "copy watch, copy handbag" men got a bit tiresome, but as two young women we had no trouble being out late at night. We didn't go to any restaurants in Kowloon, but recommend Harvester in Sheung Wan, behind the Western Market building - great vegetarian food!

Reviews.Title: “So close yet so far”
Reviews.Author: septreves
Reviews.Content: Loved our time at the Prudential. I went there with a friend and we were able to get very good rates with free late check out at 4pm. The hotel readily met our requests for a twin, no-smoking room - we just emailed the hotel a week before our stay. The room was large by HK standards, with basic amenities. Best of was the location - the hotel was so close to the MTR which was much appreciated after a long day of walking and shopping. Also, Jordan station was so near the other major stations, less the maddening crowds of Mongkok or Tsimshatsui at weekends.

Reviews.Title: “nice and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: aiteruyu
Reviews.Content: The best thing I like about Prudential Hotel is its location. It sits conveniently above the Jordan MTR station. i've been to Hong Kong twice and had previously stayed at another hotel (Nathan Hotel) which was about 10 minutes walk away from the Jordan MTR Station. After a long day of touring and shopping, I can tell you that walking 10 minutes from the station to your hotel is pretty tiring! So, Prudential's location is really great! The rooms at Prudential are also larger. There is a couch, coffee table, computer desk and chair, TV cabinet, wardrobe and a king size bed in the room we got. There were 2 of us with 1 big luggage each, and after dumping the stuff i bought everyday in the room, we still have lots of space in the room to move about. The previous hotel i stayed at had little space for me to walk around once the luggages were opened. The hotel is also very near the Temple Street Market which has quite a lot of things to buy! Just across the road is the Shamrock Hotel where the restaurant at the ground floor serves cheap and nice dim sum for breakfast! If you like HK steamed milk, there is a Yee Shun Milk Company outlet on a little street behind Shamrock hotel. There are lots of stores around Prudential hotel which makes shopping very convenient, especially if you need to do last minute shopping before flying home. I would definitely stay at Prudential Hotel if I visit HK again. :)
