Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great room but poor view”
Reviews.Author: tripper2007
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, just above the MTR station. However, there were stairs before you find the hotel, so not convenient when you first arrive and don't know where the hotel is. The room did not have a good view, but that's okay since it is common in HK anyway. The room was nicely decorated and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: kez49
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Prudential Hotel in late November 07. My booking was made after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. I found that the previous reviews were justified in recommending this hotel. My room was very modern and well decorated, one of the highlights was the large flat screen TV. The standard of the room far surpassed the money that I paid. The room was very clean with the hotel servicing it daily. To get to the hotel you must change trains twice, but once you get to the hotel the location is fantastic, with the hotel above Jordan MTR. I did a lot of exploring during my stay, and had no problem in finding the hotel again. The hotel also supplies a map of the area which is very beneficial. The only downside side would be the cost of the internet at the hotel which is $50 HK for 15 mins. I enjoyed my stay both in Hong Kong and at the Hotel. KT Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and room!”
Reviews.Author: lh6938Dallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: The location of the Prudential CAN NOT be beat. I needed to stay on the Kowloon side but even if I did not I would recommend this hotel simply for the adjoining Jordan MTR station. We bought an "octopus card" and zipped around Hong Kong, to all the sites and across the harbor in minutes. My daughter who lives in NY marveled at how superior the subway system was compared to NY. But more about the hotel...the rooms were much larger than I expected. We were told than we had been upgraded but after reading all the reviews on this hotel, we believe that they may tell everyone that and the "superior' room we got was really no different than the "standard' room booked. No matter, it's a nice marketing strategy and the bottom line was a room that was large enough for two women, all our luggage, multiple hair appliances and toiletries - you get the picture. The furnishings are basic and plain but comfortable and clean. About hair dryers - there is a built into the wall style dryer in the bathroom but we didn't know that and brought our own. I prefer mine anyway But even with an adaptor and transformer (best deal is Wal-Mart $19.95) the dryer did not blow at full power and weakened the longer you used it. The showers were fantastic...shower heads have quite a bit of pressure and plenty of hot water. The beds were very comfy, especially the comforters and pillows. The room was quiet (no noise between walls) however the doors on all rooms make a huge noise that can't be helped. If you want to sleep in, bring ear plugs. Much has been written about the buffet breakfast so I will also weigh in....it is $99 HK (about $12 US) and has made to order omelets, hot cereal called porridge which was a thin oatmeal - great mixed with the granola to thicken it up - toast, hot dishes, fruit, yoghurt, etc. Is it worth it? Yes if you want some American choices for your meal. You can also order off a menu which they won't offer unless you ask. I found out that if I only had oatmeal from the buffet, the a la carte menu price was $48 HK ($6 US). Some mornings we went to the Starbucks around the corner. Once we tried the close by Australian Dairy recommended in another review. For $22 HK you get a big plate of eggs scrambled or fried and 2 thick pieces of buttered toast plus a broth soup with macaroni in it. Very inexpensive and filling. You can also get pastries for breakfast for cheap in the subway...there's lots of clean shops in the underground. For the price we paid ($112 US) this hotel can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Unhappy staff”
Reviews.Author: Fussyman
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with my wife and 5 years old girl between 18-21 Nov. The room is ok in size for 3 Asians (with an extra bed added). Clean and simple, this hotel is great when you have a kid with you as the MTR station (Jordan) is just right below. We took the airport express train and arrived at Kowloon Station in around 20 mins. From there, we took a free shuttle bus and arrived at the 1st stop (8 mins). Just a right turn and in less than 3 mins, we turned right into the hotel entrance on Tak Shing Street. We were quickly given a room at 10th level and overlooking a bit of the busy Nathan Road (but an office building is directly opposite our room view). 7-Eleven and Watson are just nearby. Because Hong Kong is really not a place to hang around in the hotel much, the room was ok for a whole day out shopping. Breakfast and meals in the hotel are expensive. Don't bother. Go try out at a famous Hotpot Restaurant nearby or take the MTR train to Causeway Bay/Wan Chai and eat at the famous Chilli Crab Restaurant underneath a bridge. The only complain I have is that the staff at the reception (especially the guys) weren't very friendly. They gave short replies and made you feel they wanted to get you out of their sights fast. On one morning, I even overheard a lady tourist complaining to her pals that the staffs were very rude to her. She was only enquiring about where to find restaurants with dim sum on trolley but a very unhappy staff told her off coldly that there wasn't such restaurants. When she repeated her enquiries again, the staff raised his voice and said "I UNDERSTOOD YOU AND THEY ARE TOO FAR SO I DON'T BOTHER TO ADVISE ANYTHING!" She was visibly affected with such an attitude. If you can't be bothered with unhappy staff and want a hassle-free hotel with easy transportation just situated right below the hotel, Prudential Hotel in Jordan is a steal at increadible price.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and sits above a subway stop (literally)...”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my 2nd night after I couldn't extend my stay at the Eaton Hotel (see my review). I rented the Superior room (~C$150) and it was bigger than the room I had at the Eaton Hotel. The beds were softer and the TV was more modern (flatscreen). There is a pretty small security safe but it required a key, which you need to get from the front desk, although, I wasn't informed of this when I checked in - not sure why I wasn't told in advance as I'm sure most people generally use the safe to put their valuables for safe keeping. The key to the room reminded me of the key you use to enter the bathroom at a gas station - it's an actually metal key with a 1x3 inch somewhat cumbersome "keychain" which is also used to power on the room - it's definitely too big to put in my wallet. Wi-fi internet access is available from the room for a fee. All in, I was happy with the place. The location of the hotel is more central than the Eaton Hotel (i.e. closer to the park (almost across the street), and the ferry) and is right above the subway, which makes it very convenient for traveling. This hotel is also on a small side street off of Nathan Rd and can be easily reached by city bus from the airport or by the airport express.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: helen ramshaw
Reviews.Content: After spending hours searching for hotels on this site and after good feedback from others decided to book direct with the hotel. Others had advised that interconnecting rooms were available here and as we are a family of 5 this is very important to us also this site recommended asking for a room overlooking Nathan road which we did and were not disappointed. The hotel was geat the rooms of a decent size but the fact that the hotel is on top on the MTR Jordan station and a stones throw from the Temple Street markets made it a fantastic choice for us. My only gripe would be that breakfast is not included and therefore pretty expensive but we only ate there once preferring to eat at the local Mc Cafe or Starbucks or pick up food en route to attractions etc. We all LOVED HK the kids thought is amazing and Disneyland was very quiet in comparison to the USA but we thought the Ocean Park theme park even better than Disney. Also visited China for the day, thought we could go it alone but is very difficult getting the visa if you are not part of an organised trip so would not advise to go it alone, its also very expensive to get a visa on your own. Others in our party opted for the serous shopping experience but we decided in the cultural experience and only had 1 hour shopping which was enough as there is so much stuff to buy you could get seriosly carried away....many did!! A real bonus was that this hotel had a roof top swimming pool which was great after a hard days shopping, and the males in our party enjoyed star spotting as the teams playing in the HK cricket sixes were staying here including the England, South African, Australian,Pakistan and Sri Lanka teams, Would recommend this hotel to all it was really great for us.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: kmhicks
Reviews.Content: clean comfortable hotel, nathan street shops and night markets walking distance, the buffet breakfast was good value for money and filled us up till lunch, did wonder about carrots being on the menu! the underground rail was directly under the hotel and was easy to use, we bought octopus card, staff spoke english very well and were friendly, we would go back to this hotel again and would recommend it to friends and family thinking of a holiday in hong kong hotel had all basic needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice & spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Lifesacupcake
Reviews.Content: My third visit to HK, and we decided to try out this hotel. We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights from 21st to 25th August 2007, the room is rather spacious for Hong Kong standard, superb location, with MTR located in the same building, although there is nothing much in the prudential shopping complex, located in the same building. Friendly staff, breakfast was great, will surely recommended. The only minus is the tired looking swimming pool!

Reviews.Title: “Position Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingbugg
Reviews.Content: Perfect! Perfect! Perfect! The Prudential is located in the perfect spot for getting around Hong Kong. It is a very short walk to the Temple St night market, a pleasant walk to the harbour and surrounds, with plenty of shops to distract you on the way! There are plenty of local restaurants to choose from (we ate where the locals ate, and NEVER got sick!). And if you don't like walking Jordan MTR station is right below you and several buses stop right in front of the hotel - we used both modes of transport to get around (there were 5 of us so we didn't bother with a taxi) and my teenage kids were really impressed with the public transport system. We purchased the Octopus card - what a BRILLIANT idea, wish we had it here in Australia!- and went about our merry way. We visited Disneyland, Hong Kong Island, Ocean Park, Stanely Market and more, all using public transport. Don't waste your money on organized tours for these - it is so easy to get around! We found the hotel itself very very comfortable. We were unable to get connecting rooms, but we did get adjoining rooms and this worked just as well as we didn't actually spend much time in them! The rooms are really quite spacious (I have stayed at the Park Hotel before and the Prudential was much much better!) very, very clean and comfortable. The hotel staff were polite, attentive and very helpful. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, most especially if you have never been to Hong Kong before. The distinctive facade and observation tower on the roof made it easy to spot from the bus, so we knew when to get off! LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Love & Hate”
Reviews.Author: Tengak
Reviews.Content: Love the general location of the hotel which is central to shops, food stores and night markets in the Jordan area. In fact it is built right over the Jordan MTR underground station. Venture into side lanes, you'll experience the local atmosphere and culture. Yet it is within walking distance to the glitzy Tsim Sha Tsui commercial precinct, the Promenade and the Star Ferry Pier. Hate the hidden entrance to the hotel which is actually not on Nathan road but around the corner at the narrow Tak Shing Street and up a flight of stairs. Very often the Airport coaches refuse to negotiate the narrow lane and drop you off at busy Nathan Road instead and you'll have to drag your luggage to the hotel. It is particularly disconcerting when you are expecting a hotel entrance at Nathan Road but instead face steps to a shopping centre with no sign indicating where the hotel really is. Another dislike is that rooms not at Nathan Road side of the hotel will have a view of ugly tenements when you draw the blinds from the window.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: CPMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for 2 adults and 3 children. Each room was set up with two twin beds each and when we questionned where the extra bed was, we were told that there is an extra charge! The rooms are very small. The location was decent. Probably would not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: annt
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a week in this hotel in June. The location is excellent and being able to access the MTR without going outside (the Jordan station is under the hotel) was brilliant. Our room was clean and quiet, our beds comfortable and our view was over the busy Nathan Road. The staff of this hotel are marvellous. A porter appeared as we approached the front entrance, took our luggage and it was delivered to our room within minutes of our arrival there. We had such a lovely room maid - she was always happy and smiling, did her work thoroughly and nothing was too much trouble for her. The concierges were always patient and helpful. Stanley was outstandingly good - if he didn't know the answer to our queries, he knew how to find out - and with a big smile. Our postcards were posted for us, our visas for China were obtained without hassle, (Thank you Stanley) our shuttle bus to the airport for our departure was organised (Thank you Mr. Terron Wong) Reception staff were friendly and informative. We required the services of a doctor while we were there and they sent us to a nearby medical practice which was excellent. The rooftop swimming pool was clean and at a comfortable temperature. I would very definitely return to this hotel. I really enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Kiri22
Reviews.Content: We chose the prudential because we wanted to be close to the Temple St Markets. We are a family of 5 and had interconnecting rooms. The location was fantastic, at first I wanted to be on the water front but couldn't book anything there that was in our budget. I am so glad I didn't because when I walked down there, the atmosphere isnt nearly as good as being back where all the action and shops and markets are.. You also have the subway directly underneath the hotel so its off the train and up to your room, perfect. The hotel restaurant was excellent, best seafood buffet I have had and the service was also very good. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, good Quality”
Reviews.Author: PanamaRed
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, great location for business trips, high speed wireless was a big help. Rooms are clean and nicely sized for Hong Kong matchbox standards. Would go back if needed to

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: jakesbackdoor
Reviews.Content: What this hotel lacks with the room decor, it makes up with the location. The rooms are a little tired, but in Hong Kong you should not be spending much time in your rooms anyways. The loaction is great, just above the Jordon subway station. You are 2 subway stops in one direction to the Ladies Market and 2 stops in the opposite direction you are at Hong Kong Central. The Temple night market is a few easy block walk and it takes about 15 min to walk to the Hong Kong harbour. For restaurants make sure try Knutsford Terrace for an entire street of different eats. Highly recommend going here in the evening for a meal and some people watching. If you are getting a little tired of the city, just across the street from the hotel is a huge park where you can escape and feed the fish.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Easy access for exploration”
Reviews.Author: meao
Reviews.Content: The Room Imagine an above average motel room... or compare it to your average holiday inn express/ four points Sheraton. The hotel is great for the price, the location. This is a room for you to rest your head for the night, and get up to do explorations around Hong Kong in the morning. Easy access to the MTR station (direct exit), a well priced mall connected to the hotel, directly across from many local eats, or walk up the street to Nathan road for fancier treats. It's a very well located hotel. We got a room that faced the major street, which we liked. The Concierge Hmm... how shall I say this.... well built helpful young men who are courteous and some of them thoughtful. They are the ones who knows the tips and tricks around the city... they've seen more set ups and travel arrangements and sometimes can give you the best price to achieve your travelling goals. E.g. on our return trip planning to head to the airport, we had 6 pieces of luggage with 4 pieces being large baggage... at first I thought we would hire two taxis, get to the Airport Express, drop off the luggage for check in, then continue to cruise the city for a bit before we have to head to the Airport Express to catch our flight. The hotel concierge boys suggested that we simply take the taxi to the airport, and assured us that the taxi will take all 6 luggage’s with 3 carry on parcels... for a nominal price increase but substantial improvement in comfort and efficiency. Hotel Experience with Staff In general the staff was helpful... though their hotel management policies are slightly different from the average hotel. E.g. They ask you to prepay for the full amount upfront E.g. The hotel guest must return the key to the front desk every time they leave the hotel, then retrieve the key again if you want to enter your room (we just took our key with us... no one said anything :P) I think it's to help the staff determine which guests are here and which ones are out of the building Amenities - In room Safe - key safe, free of charge, need to get key from the front desk - elevators - if you are not afraid of heights, you might marvel at the view - room light - too dim to my liking - lobby - busy, with people of all races and tours - definitely not a place to lounge. Either get in your room or go explore the city or something.... :) Other I actually went to the hotel to see the room size before checking in. The staff was very nice and showed me the room. After seeking his advice, I decided not to upgrade the room. We were able to fit three adults and 6 pieces of large luggage in the room. We were only there for 2 nights, so albeit it was a tight fit, it was sufficient and bearable. If it were for a short stay, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in best location”
Reviews.Author: X-7
Reviews.Content: The Prudential Hotel is located close to MTR-Jordan Station in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui. Nightmarket and markets of Mongkok are easy to reach by foot. The hotel has nice and friendly staff. The rooms are big and clean (cleaned daily) , the beds comfy. The air-con worked and so it was a pleasant stay at Prudential Hotel. One thing: The swimming pool is closed during winter months.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, comfortable and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: topfca
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an 8 night stay at this hotel over the New Year period. I booked this hotel after reading numerous reviews on this website mainly due to its location but also because it offered a competitive price at an expensive time of year. I really think some of the previous reviewers need to realise that this is not a 5 star hotel and it doesn't pretend to be. Don't look for 5 star trimmings and you will be more than satisfied. I arrived mid afternoon on Boxing Day and checked in within less than 5 minutes. I had a comfortable room on the 11th floor with a side view of part of Nathan Road and a bed almost 7 feet wide just for me. The rooms are relatively large and maybe a little spartan but everything you need is there including a comfortable desk area. The bathroom is functional with extremely high pressure taps and my biggest gripe of all was that the liquid soap dispenser in the bath/shower was at shower level so for those of us who prefer a bath, you have to keep standing up to get to the soap! Bed linen is changed daily provided you leave a little cardboard tree in the bed and room cleaning is efficient and unobtrusive. Quite why the maids felt it necessary to switch on the air conditioner and turn it to maximum cold each day is a mystery but then Hong Kong does seem to like its air conditioning even at times of year when it is not really necessary. What the hotel does suffer from is a lack of soundproofing between the rooms and the corridors outside and as other reviewers have noted, noisy guests can be annoying especially early in the morning if you want to sleep in. There is a good restaurant serving sensibly priced buffet meals which have extensive choice together with an all day menu. Although the buffet was never cleared away before the stated closure time, there was a tendency to remove the bilingual descriptions by each item some 15 minutes before the buffet closed which meant that in some cases, one didn't know what one was eating! There is a lack of any central lounge space as the lobby is rather small and this is a pity. The location is superb with the Jordan MTR station immediately underneath the hotel and the Temple Street night market within less than 5 minutes' walk. All in all, a good value and eficient hotel without too many fancy extras, reasonably priced and well located. I would recommended it to anyone wanting a "mid range plus" place to stay in central Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “so comfortable with great location”
Reviews.Author: bham.rich
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Prudential early morning around 9 am. We didnt expect to be able to check in as it was so early, the staff were most helpful and offered us our room straight away even though check in is not normally till 2 am. Our room was spacious, very clean, warm and the beds very comfortable. We had no problems with noise off others guests, in all that problem is just down to other guest with no respect for others, a problem which could occur in any hotel. Access to airport was very good taxi to Kowloon for airport express was 20hkd. Def recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: SL227
Reviews.Content: We go back to Hong Kong every year to visit family and had stayed in Prudential in 2005. We were happy with it last year, so decided to stay there again this year. It has a great location with many restaurants and shops nearby and reasonable priced. However, the hotel seems to have deteriorated since 2005. We stayed 5 nights at the end of Nov. 2006. We booked a moderate priced non-smoking room through Expedia (average US$130/night plus taxes). We were upgraded to floor 13 due to full occupancy. The room is at the end of the hall (room 1301) and immedialy upon opening the door, the room smells of carpet cleaning detergent or something (it was really strong). I had to turn the air conditioner to high to try to remove the smell, only to a certain degree. We were tired from the long flight and it was late, so we didn't bother to request for a room change. Eventually, we got used to the smell. The room is pretty big by HK standard with a hard bed, but the bathroom is very small and not that clean, and the tub doesn't drain water fast enough. The toilet paper is especially rough and cheap. Overall, we were disappointed with this hotel and will not stay here again next year. For the price we paid, we had other choices.

Reviews.Title: “Central in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Keith.Voorschoten
Reviews.Content: A reasonably priced hotel centrally located on Nathan Road over the Jordan MTR underground station. The Star Feyy, main shopping malls of Ocean Terminal and Langham Place as well as the restaurants on Knutsford Steps all within 10 mins walking distance. Clean room with mini-bar, desk and TV but no space for storing clothes apart from a small hanging area. The pool on the roof was clean and of a good size but sitting there was noisy with all the air con vents.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, With Spacious Rooms and Good Security”
Reviews.Author: rainyh
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative feedback, I really didn't pin too much hope on this hotel... But my four nights stay was excellent!!! Good Location: It is directly above Jordan MTR which is really convenient for people to travel. However, after certain hour at night, the door connecting to the buidling in which you could take the escalator down to the MTR will be closed. You have to walk out of the building and make a turn... But it won't take up too much time and energy... Spacious Room: Having staying at Standford Hillview Hotel before, Prudential is definitely offering a more spacious room for triple. After adding an extra bed in a twin sharing room, we still have ample space to place our luggages and walk around. The room is clean and so does the bathroom. Good Secruity: To close off the connection between the Hotel to the shopping buidling seems to be a way to step up the secruity level of the hotel... Each lobby has view cam. My friend and I were waiting outside for my other friend who was bathing in the room to open the door for us... In the meanwhile we took pic of the lobby and when we almost wanted to sit on the floor, a hotel staff with a walkie talkie came out of the lift and walkin towards us... see how fast they are... I understand that each of us has different expectation. People who complain may have a totally different experience. But still, I think this hotel is definitely good for families and people who intend to have a triple sharing. I have stayed in the 10th floor and it seems to have just renovated. For people who don't smoke, 10th floor will be excellent as it has a big sign stating it is a NON-SMOKING FLOOR...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fluffypurples22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights and really can`t see what everyone is making such a fuss about. Our only problem was finding it! The Prudential is slap bang in the middle of Nathan Rd - a perfect location for a Hong Kong shopping veteran, with Temple St 5 mins walk to the right and the glorious haven of Kowloon Park 5 mins to the left. The entrance wasn`t very well signed and although we had a pretty good idea where it was, we wandered aomlessly round the 1st floor of the shopping centre for 10 mins before seeing an entrance to get up to the 2nd floor. There is a "proper" entrance just round to the left hand side of the building. I think that access for the disabled would prove a problem from the ground level as I saw no lifts or ramps,but then unfortunately Hong Kong isn`t particularly disabled friendly anywhere you go. The reception staff were polite and very efficient and we were checked in within minutes. Our special requests (non smoking/twin on a high floor) had all been met and the glass lifts are terrific. The room was exactly like every other standard room I`ve stayed in in Hong Kong, nothing flash but spotlessly clean, relatively spacious and a wonderfully comfy bed. We overlooked Nathan Rd but couldn`t hear the outside world at all. The bathroom was fine although the lighting was incredibly dim, but the powerful shower more than made up for any other gripes. The cleaners did a great job and tea/sugar stocks were always replenished. The roof top pool makes for a nice escape from the hustle and bustle going on beneath and there are plenty of loungers(didn`t see any towels) The only criticism there is a constant whirring from the electrical equipment but the view is spectacular. This is the 7th hotel I`ve stayed in in Hong Kong and I would certainly recommend it and would definitely stay there again. If you want 5 star luxury then you need to pay for it in Hong Kong but for the amount of time you should be spending in your room, this hotel is ideal

Reviews.Title: “A good HK hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jp7541
Reviews.Content: A great location in Hong Kong. The room was fine. The bathroom was clean, but no ventillation meant that it would steam up real quickly. The Pool was ok too. A seemingly pointless water wall restricts your entrance to it though. More of an injury risk as guests do their best to avoid getting wet on entering and leaving the pool area. It was a bit noisy up there, so not a peaceful retreat but you do get the HK sun all day long up there. The place still unfortunately uses keys still. This is a bit inconvenient when you each want to do your own thing. The staff were helpful enough, although some of the desk staff appeared relatively undertrained. But not a problem as the more experienced staff were able to help out with, just required a little patience. A few previous reviewers have said the hotel is noisy, but there is not much the staff can do about noisy guests. Overall a good hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers7
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Prudential for 3 nights in April and were expecting the worst as had read the reviews on this site. But when arrived we were met with a friendly smiley face from the concierge team who took our bags and told us where to check in. The staff on recption desk were alittle blunt at times and not as helpful or friendly as the concierge staff were. Check in was smooth and got the type of room we requested we were on the 13th floor - the room was adequete size the bed was not the hardest we had had in asia but unfortunately the view from the room was of an office block so had to keep the blind down all day. I visited the pool area on the roof it was small but the view was great. The glass lift was also a cool thing to ride in at night as got a good view of the street and all the lights which i have to say is brighter than Las Vegas All in all we found the Prudential a nice hotel to stay at great location as on top of the Jordan MTR Station with plenty of shops/markets and resturants, all with in walking distance and it is a nice 10 minute stroll down to the harbour/ Star ferry. I would recommend staying at the Prudential if you want a average 3 star hotel but with great location to get around Hong Kong with ease.

Reviews.Title: “Not so happy....”
Reviews.Author: ikoihil
Reviews.Content: Not impressed. Hotel is difficult to find, but in a convenient spot near the Temple Street Night Market - I recommend going, and having dinner on the street at a seafood restaurant. Rooms are small and damp, bathroom floors had scum in the corners, the shower curtain was one of those you just avoid touching. No views from the room and the pool was closed for the 'Season' although we were there during spring break and it was about 80F. Although the maids couldn't find time to clean the dirty floor, she complained about makeup on a washcloth and left a note for us to call management. After I threw it in the sink and swished it around a few times, the makeup came out... nothing that impossible with some bleach and a washing machine... I called mgmt and had them clean the floors. Oh, and the toilet doesn't flush until you pump the handle about 5 times. Only upside: Jordan MTR station is *underneath* the hotel, which makes transport easy. Do, however, request a room on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget Hotel close to shopping”
Reviews.Author: hoteman
Reviews.Content: Our family had just returned from Hong Kong where we stayed at the Prudential. The location was excellent. It's right on Nathan Road and within walking distance to the Star Ferry, subway and of course, the Temple Street Market. The rooms were small but clean. We had adjoining rooms which was an excellent feature for our teenage boys. On our 2nd day at the hotel, the electricity was shut off due to yearly maintenance. We barely had time to finish our breakfast and the lifts were shut down. Our choice was to climb up 12 floors to our hotel room or line up for the service elevator. My husband complained and a fruit basket and 4 dinner coupons were waiting in our rooms when we returned after a day of sightseeing. The pool was closed for the winter although we were there in mid March. The dinner buffet was excellent but the breakfast buffet was average. The hotel staff were fairly helpful and friendly. Overall, it's a good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel HK”
Reviews.Author: CynWong
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a few different hotels in Kowloon before and by far this was the worst hotel ever. First of all, when I came out of my taxi, there was no one to help me with my suitcase. I had to carry it up the stairs past the doorman and up a narrow escalator before I reached the main lobby. The check in was ok. Staff was indifferent to my complaint about not having any help with my suitcase. The rooms were bare. Towels were extremely flimsy. The worst part is that the mattress sank a few inches when I sat on both of the twin size beds in the room. When I called to complain, they actually told me they had wooden boards available to put under the mattress!! Perhaps they should invest in real mattresses instead! It took them over an hr to come and put the boards in, and it was already past midnite after my arrival. I had to call reception 3 times. I was scheduled for a weeks stay and promptly changed hotels the next night. I ended up at the royal plaza. Paid a lot less for a much bigger room. It was a little older, but way more luxurious. I would never stay at the prudential again. I seriously recommend staying at any alternative hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanna21
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hotel in March and was very impressed. The room and the bathroom were large, clean and comfy. Compared to other hotels ive stayed in this was by far the best. The view from our room was of a back street but we were to busy exploring HK to be worried about that. It was in an ideal location on Nathan road above the Jordon subway which was great. The lobby was very busy at times and was very smokey but it didnt bother us. When we arrived our cases were taken straight up to the rooms and the concierge and the reception staff could not do enough for us. we did not use the gym and the pool was closed. All in all for the price we paid (£45 per night for 2 people) it was great value for money and i would certainly recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Prudential Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.222 Nathan Road, Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong, China
